commit_message:
V1.1 Homedoc

Updated the homedoc to match the spec listed on
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Marconi/specs/api/v1.1
Implements: blueprint api-v1.1-homedoc-changes
Change-Id: I7fa33413d38095b04b0e1e513974cb3887420802

commit_message:
Add API support for flavors

This patch adds the control API for flavors. The patch allows users to
create, delete, update and list flavors. This API is considered an
admin-only API, hence it's registered as part of the private endpoints.

DocImpact

Partially-Implements blueprint marconi-queue-flavors

Change-Id: Id29d29940f2ecabab0531edefe018c0dd2f39811

commit_message:
db API add show_nested to stack_get_all

Adds the option to get all stacks including nested stack, defaulted
to False.

blueprint: list-nested
Change-Id: Ide975d9cd2ca24473ff3ac522848e7ff5f23e6aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-02 16:19:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'HyperV - Fix to implement hypervisor-uptime

The hyperv driver currently does not return the hypervisor-uptime.
This fix does the necessary changes to return the hypervisor-uptime
using the windows function GetTickCount64
More details about this function available at
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms724411%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

The function GetTickCount64 returns in millisecs the time since the host
is up. This fix converts the millisecs to Days/Hours/Mins/Secs using
datetime.timedelta.

Change-Id: Ib3cd90b17f64e369badaddb764ac9e6b9f6c1a4b
Closes-Bug: #1335559
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-06 16:37:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'HyperV Driver - Fix to implement hypervisor-uptime

The hyperv driver currently does not return the hypervisor-uptime.
This fix does the necessary changes to return the hypervisor-uptime.
The uptime returned is in similar format to libvirt driver uptime

The uptime is based on the following:
1. Using the windows function GetTickCount64
More details about this function available at
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms724411%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

The function GetTickCount64 returns in millisecs the time since the host
is up.

2. Using WMI class Win32_PerfFormattedData_PerfOS_Processor
to check cpu load
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa394271(v=vs.85).aspx

3. Using WMI class Win32_LogonSession to check
the number of users logged in.
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa394189(v=vs.85).aspx

Change-Id: Ib3cd90b17f64e369badaddb764ac9e6b9f6c1a4b
Closes-Bug: #1335559
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-07-17 14:31:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'HyperV Driver - Fix to implement hypervisor-uptime

commit_message:
HyperV Driver - Fix to implement hypervisor-uptime

The hyperv driver currently does not return the hypervisor-uptime.
This fix does the necessary changes to return the hypervisor-uptime.
The uptime returned is in similar format to libvirt driver uptime

The uptime is calculated using the windows function GetTickCount64
More details about this function available at
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms724411%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

The function GetTickCount64 returns in millisecs the time since the host
is up.

Change-Id: Ib3cd90b17f64e369badaddb764ac9e6b9f6c1a4b
Closes-Bug: #1335559

commit_message:
Remove wsgi and base controller dependency on token_api

The wsgi module and the base controller no longer depends on the
token_api, to interact with the token persistence system. The
token_provider_api.validate_token method and the KeystoneToken model
are now used.

This change is to ensure interactions with the token persistence system
are consistent and supporting the ability to toggle token persistence
in the future.

Change-Id: I5831d6a086241bc3a6691602e7527ae53c9411ce
bp: non-persistent-tokens

Keystone wasn't handling the Accept header for GET /v3 according to
the HTTP 1.1 spec[1]. This change enhances the Keystone server so
that it supports using multiple values and qvalues in the Accept
header for GET /v3. This allows requesting a JSON Home or JSON
response with a preference for JSON Home, for example.

commit_message:
Enhance GET /v3 to handle Accept header

Keystone wasn't handling the Accept header for GET /v3 according to
the HTTP 1.1 spec[1]. This change enhances the Keystone server so
that it supports using multiple values and qvalues in the Accept
header for GET /v3. This allows requesting a JSON Home or JSON
response with a preference for JSON Home, for example.

[1] http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-14.1

bp json-home

Change-Id: Ifb204b6860c61a874ecbf92388878685ac437987

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-13 17:48:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'VMware: Remove _normalize_ip function

A floating IP fails to be assigned to an instance on
VMware, using VMwareVCDriver and nova-network.  The following
error is thrown: "NotImplementedError: Cannot load 'instance'
in the base class". The problem is caused by _normalize_ip,
which tries to assign an instance key to the FloatingIP object
that is needed by _translate_floating_ip_view. However, the
FloatingIP object does not have an instance field. Since
_translate_floating_ip_view just requires the instance UUID to
be assigned and returned as part of the result dict, the logic
to obtained the instance UUID is moved into
_translate_floating_ip_view, instead of assigning an instance key
to the FloatingIP object.

Change-Id: I2d7937e969bd87e53557842a22f3861f0d307b5e
Closes-Bug: #1356051
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-13 18:43:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'VMware: Remove _normalize_ip function

A floating IP fails to be assigned to an instance on
VMware, using VMwareVCDriver and nova-network.  The following
error is thrown: "NotImplementedError: Cannot load 'instance'
in the base class". The problem is caused by _normalize_ip,
which tries to assign an instance key to the FloatingIP object
that is needed by _translate_floating_ip_view. However, the
FloatingIP object does not have an instance field. Since
_translate_floating_ip_view just requires the instance UUID to
be assigned and returned as part of the result dict, the logic
to obtained the instance UUID is moved into
_translate_floating_ip_view, instead of assigning an instance key
to the FloatingIP object.

Change-Id: I2d7937e969bd87e53557842a22f3861f0d307b5e
Closes-Bug: #1356051
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-08-13 20:11:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'VMware: Set default value for floating_ip['instance']

A list of existing floating IP (nova floating-ip-list) fails
on VMware, using VMwareVCDriver and nova-network.  The
following error is thrown: "NotImplementedError: Cannot load
'instance' in the base class". The problem is caused by
_normalize_ip, which tries to set an 'instance' field in
FloatingIP that is needed by _translate_floating_ip_view. The
instance is derived from the FixedIP that is assigned to the
'fixed_ip' field in FloatingIP. However, FixedIP may not have
an 'instance' field set, which can cause the NotImplementedError.
This can be fixed by returning a default empty dict when making
the get call.

Change-Id: I2d7937e969bd87e53557842a22f3861f0d307b5e
Closes-Bug: #1356051
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-08-14 15:29:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_floating_ips.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/floating_ips.py'], 'message': 'Fix NotImplementedError in floating-ip-list

A list of existing floating IP (nova floating-ip-list) fails
when using VMwareVCDriver/LibvirtDriver and nova-network.
The following error is thrown: "NotImplementedError: Cannot load
'instance' in the base class". The problem is caused by
_normalize_ip, which tries to set an 'instance' field in
FloatingIP that is needed by _translate_floating_ip_view. The
instance is derived from the FixedIP that is assigned to the
'fixed_ip' field in FloatingIP. However, FixedIP may not have
an 'instance' field set, which can cause the NotImplementedError.

The following patch removes _normalize_ip and assigns the
'instance_id' required by _translate_floating_ip_view to
the 'instance_uuid' in FixedIP, since only the instance ID
is required and not the entire instance object.

Change-Id: I2d7937e969bd87e53557842a22f3861f0d307b5e
Closes-Bug: #1356051
', 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Fix NotImplementedError in floating-ip-list

A list of existing floating IP (nova floating-ip-list) fails
when using VMwareVCDriver/LibvirtDriver and nova-network.
The following error is thrown: "NotImplementedError: Cannot load
'instance' in the base class". The problem is caused by
_normalize_ip, which tries to set an 'instance' field in
FloatingIP that is needed by _translate_floating_ip_view. The
instance is derived from the FixedIP that is assigned to the
'fixed_ip' field in FloatingIP. However, FixedIP may not have
an 'instance' field set, which can cause the NotImplementedError.

The following patch removes _normalize_ip and assigns the
'instance_id' required by _translate_floating_ip_view to
the 'instance_uuid' in FixedIP, since only the instance ID
is required and not the entire instance object.

Change-Id: I2d7937e969bd87e53557842a22f3861f0d307b5e

commit_message:
Use checked commit when committing kazoo transactions

To avoid the case where the transaction appears to have
committed successfully (when it actually has not) create
a new checked_commit utility function and use it in the
zookeeper persistence backend to ensure that the transaction
has completed correctly (when it has not raise a new kazoo
exception that contains the failures to the caller, which can
then reraise that exception, examine the failures or do some
other action).

Change-Id: Ib169b36abb568a0e1516c4c786fccb30856661e1

commit_message:
Add console interface to agent_ipmitool driver

The agent_ipmitool driver (ironic.drivers.agent.AgentAndIPMIToolDriver)
doesn't have a console interface. It should be using IPMITools'
IPMIShellinaboxConsole().

Change-Id: I780ff2df9ed1d673fa5f124efb73ca3ecd945c85
Closes-Bug: #1359466

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-18 18:03:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove identity_api dependency on token_api

Remove the identity_api dependency on token_api. Now for each type
of event that would cause revocations (or delete of tokens) to occur
an internal callback notification is emitted and consumed by the
token_provider_api and the revoke_api (as appropriate). This required
a few new notification entity types ('user_password',
'user_removed_from_group'), but since these are not public notifications
the overhead should be minimal.

This change is to ensure interactions with the token persistence system
are consistent and supporting the ability to toggle token persistence
in the future.

Change-Id: I796f1b003a9d43b89940bb74d2c44d3cff215c72
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Remove identity_api dependency on token_api

Remove the identity_api dependency on token_api. Now for each type
of event that would cause revocations (or delete of tokens) to occur
an internal callback notification is emitted and consumed by the
token_provider_api and the revoke_api (as appropriate). This required
a few new notification entity types ('user_password',
'user_removed_from_group'), but since these are not public notifications
the overhead should be minimal.

This change is to ensure interactions with the token persistence system
are consistent and supporting the ability to toggle token persistence
in the future.

Change-Id: I796f1b003a9d43b89940bb74d2c44d3cff215c72
bp: non-persistent-tokens

subject: Remove trust dependency on token_api

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-25 00:44:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove trust dependency on token_api

The trust_api and controllers no longer directly depend on the
token_api. The `validate_token` call on the `token_provider_api`
is now used to retrive token data.

The token_provider_api listens for trust deletion events to clean
up the token persistence backend. In support of this callback, it
is now possible to perform a .get_trust() and specifically request
deleted / expired / fully consumed trusts. This is done by passing
the kwarg 'deleted' with a value of 'True' to the `get_trust`
method.

This change is to ensure interactions with the token persistence
are consistent so that it is possible to support toggling
persistence of tokens.

Change-Id: Ifc7174d6473dfa279b3dc706a59bc58c812332b3
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Remove trust dependency on token_api

The trust_api and controllers no longer directly depend on the
token_api. The `validate_token` call on the `token_provider_api`
is now used to retrieve token data.

The token_provider_api listens for trust deletion events to clean
up the token persistence backend. In support of this callback, it
is now possible to perform a .get_trust() and specifically request
deleted / expired / fully consumed trusts. This is done by passing
the kwarg 'deleted' with a value of 'True' to the `get_trust`
method.

This change is to ensure interactions with the token persistence
are consistent so that it is possible to support toggling
persistence of tokens.

Change-Id: Ifc7174d6473dfa279b3dc706a59bc58c812332b3
bp: non-persistent-tokens

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-12 03:18:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Update AuthContextMiddleware to not use token_api

AuthContextMiddleware and the fall-through in the controller base
_build_policy_check_credentials now utilizes the KeystoneToken
model and uses token_provider_api instead of token_api.

In support of this change, the token auth plugin, the auth_context
builder, token bind check, and token controller have all been updated
to utilize the KeystoneToken model. Support for the federation data
has been added to the KeystoneToken model so that it can be used
in the auth context and associated code.

Associated tests that passed a raw token_ref to methods that now
expect the KeystoneToken model have been updated. This includes an
update to the revocation model to guard against users without domain
data (the federated user case).

Change-Id: I81da15137a0ab3778d835c8de1ec8ed9e5b301f6
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
Update AuthContextMiddleware to not use token_api

AuthContextMiddleware and the fall-through in the controller base
_build_policy_check_credentials now utilizes the KeystoneToken
model and uses token_provider_api instead of token_api.

In support of this change, the token auth plugin, the auth_context
builder, token bind check, and token controller have all been updated
to utilize the KeystoneToken model. Support for the federation data
has been added to the KeystoneToken model so that it can be used
in the auth context and associated code.

Associated tests that passed a raw token_ref to methods that now
expect the KeystoneToken model have been updated. This includes an
update to the revocation model to guard against users without domain
data (the federated user case).

Change-Id: I81da15137a0ab3778d835c8de1ec8ed9e5b301f6
bp: non-persistent-tokens

Fixes failing devstack tests when Mistral is installed (style error)
  and a bit of extra info in README file.

commit_message:
Working on linear workflow: on_task_result()

* Implementing LinearWorkflowHandler.on_task_result()
* Unit tests

TODO:
 * Method get_upstream_tasks() is not really applicable for linear workflow
   so we may need to redesign this part workflow handler contract

Change-Id: Ib39c37a2a8fa56c6dbdf664922b939cc218fcd67

commit_message:
Horizon changes for DVR

Feature completed :
1. Admin router panel
   + New "Distributed" column introduced.
   + New Field "Distributed" added on to
     router detail panel
2. Project router panel
   if logged in as "Admin"
   ======================
   + New distributed column introduced.
   + New Field distributed column added on to
     router detail panel.
   + New Router Field dropdown box introduced in
     create router form.
   if logged in as "nonAdmin"
   =========================
   + Router Type dropdown will be invisible for
     non admin.
   + Distributed information will be
     hidden from details panel.

implements: blueprint enhance-horizon-for-dvr

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <motoki@da.jp.nec.com>

Change-Id: I995745dd72a8b750866c0977a7d7cf42036f716f

commit_message:
Raise HTTPNotFound error from V2 cert show API

There might be possibility of not having the CA file while
requesting certificate show API. API should raise HTTPNotFound
for clear error.
This patch raise this exception for V2 API. This has been fixed in
V3 API.

Adding UT also for the same.

Change-Id: Iafb33fce6433a31f9767067bbc45b95acd4ee511

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-25 00:42:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'auth_token cached token handling

auth_token handles tokens that are from its cache, uncached PKI
(compressed and ASN, "offline validation") and UUID/hashed tokens
("online" validation).

For all of these cases, the auth_token middleware was doing

1) expiration check
2) confirm token bind
3) store in cache

In some cases, some of these steps aren't necessary.

When getting the token from the cache
1) no expiration check is needed because the expiration time is
   stored as cache data and the token would be rejected during
   _cache_get.
2) Storing in the cache is unnecessary because the token is
   already in the cache.

When doing online validation, it's not necessary to do the
expiration check because the identity server would have rejected
the token if it was expired.

Closes-Bug: #1289075
Change-Id: I6afa98504215521538434f1f8a2d97585ce35de5

commit_message:
auth_token cached token handling

auth_token handles tokens that are from its cache, uncached PKI
(compressed and ASN, "offline validation") and UUID/hashed tokens
("online" validation).

For all of these cases, the auth_token middleware was doing

1) expiration check
2) confirm token bind
3) store in cache

In some cases, some of these steps aren't necessary.

When getting the token from the cache
1) no expiration check is needed because the expiration time is
   stored as cache data and the token would be rejected during
   _cache_get.
2) Storing in the cache is unnecessary because the token is
   already in the cache.

When doing online validation, it's not necessary to do the
expiration check because the identity server would have rejected
the token if it was expired.

Closes-Bug: #1289075
Change-Id: I6afa98504215521538434f1f8a2d97585ce35de5

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V basic scenario volume partition name

On Hyper-V volumes are attached to SCSI passthrough devices that have a
progressive naming (sdb, sdc etc) and cannot match the requested name
(e.g. vdb).

Closes-bug: #1357925
Co-Authored-By: Adrian Bora <abora@cloudbasesolutions.com>
DocImpact
Change-Id: I429b07d2ed55e7875034bc10510a039f6042c724

commit_message:
Adds support for custom image formats in scenarios

Scenario Tempest tests don't work on Hyper-V due to the missing
support for VHD/VHDX image formats in the Tempest scenario comfiguration.

The commits adds options to specify custom image disk and container
formats, mantaining 'QCoW2' and 'bare' as the default options for
backwards compatibility.

Closes-bug: #1357691
Co-Authored-By: Ionut Balutoiu <ibalutoiu@cloudbasesolutions.com>
DocImpact

Change-Id: I41c09d5a682cdb068b97b4bd1be3403ee7973c7c

commit_message:
Hide the "Host Aggregates" admin panel if not enabled.

This checks ehther the extension is supported in nova and disables
access to the panel (hiding it) if not.

Closes-Bug: #1332066

Change-Id: Ibe35e0c46ac85e4e32b49453fa7fea0c3bb66548

  the structure of tables and other constructs
- Provides a system whereby "migration scripts" may be constructed;
  each script indicates a particular series of steps that can "upgrade"

  that can "downgrade" similarly, doing the same steps in reverse.

3. Remove manila/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo directory.
4. Fix unit tests.
5. Add ability to runtime updrade/downgrade db.

commit_message:
Use Alembic instead of Sqlalchemy-migrate in Manila

Alembic offers the following functionality:
- Can emit ALTER statements to a database in order to change
  the structure of tables and other constructs
- Provides a system whereby "migration scripts" may be constructed;
  each script indicates a particular series of steps that can "upgrade"
  a target database to a new version, and optionally a series of steps
  that can "downgrade" similarly, doing the same steps in reverse.
- Allows the scripts to execute in some sequential manner.

1. Add Alembic migrations support.
2. Move 001_manila_init.py migration to
manila/db/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/162a3e673105_manila_init.py.
3. Remove manila/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo directory.
4. Fix unit tests.
5. Add ability to runtime updrade/downgrade db.

Implements bp alembic-instead-of-sqlalchemy-migrate

Change-Id: Iadc0d9596e826323ba19bd25be741c401b90b688

commit_message:
Add an example how to change MTU via CLI.

Add an example of a "network_scheme" section in a node's configuration, showing how
to change MTU parameters.

Change-Id: I3e525972a3fac3dc398ccfb241d6ee0576ff58f9
Closes-Bug: 1340288

commit_message:
Sync latest processutils from oslo-incubator

This sync is primarily being done to pull in commit
63c99a0f so that passwords are masked in exception and
error messages.

------------------------------------------------

oslo-incubator head:

commit 80a08a413fb0f23a056eca2d273b167f0a09bab6
Merge: 83c4098 d73f3b1
Author: Jenkins <jenkins@review.openstack.org>
Date:   Mon Aug 25 14:32:36 2014 +0000

    Merge "Remove unused/mutable default args"

-----------------------------------------------

The sync pulls in the following changes (newest to oldest):

63c99a0f - Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages
e184dd36 - Fix exception message in openstack.common.processutils.execute
d6b55fb2 - Remove `processutils` dependency on `log`

-----------------------------------------------

Change-Id: Ia92aab76fa83d01c5fbf6f9d31df2463fc26ba5c
Partial-bug: 1343604

commit_message:
Increase the default poll duration for Cisco n1kv

Increase the poll duration for Cisco N1Kv, from 10s to 60s and also
clean up the /etc/neutron/plugins/cisco/cisco_plugins.ini file. The
current poll duration of 10s causes that VSM to unnecessarily taking
frequent CPU cycles, resulting in the failure of other tasks in scale
configurations.

Closes-Bug: 1357030

Change-Id: I95747f35bae5b7157391c1698c0fe84d2126aa10

commit_message:
Validate cores and ram when booting instance

There is no validating for cores and ram in creating instance workflow.
The user can submit the form even the requested cores or ram are exceed
the quota.

Change-Id: I25d49f709d120a6a56692b174e17969cba1c8065
Closes-bug: 1349370

commit_message:
Enhance V3 extensions to provide JSON Home data

The V3 extensions are enhanced to provide JSON Home data for each
of the resources that they provide.

bp json-home

Change-Id: I6466cd583b22b260f8979717fa6ceafcbf252839

commit_message:
Enhance V3 extension class to integrate JSON Home data

The V3 extension class is enhanced to intercept JSON Home responses
and modify the response to include any JSON Home data that the
extension provides. Note that there is no JSON Home data provided
yet.

bp json-home

Change-Id: I940cef418b9a2f199ebd804b66dabe688f4845b8

commit_message:
Working on engine implementation: on_task_result()

* Implementing DefaultEngine.on_task_result()
* Unit tests
* Fixing ReverseWorkflowHandler
* Renaming 'task_result' to 'raw_result' in method signatures
* Other minor fixes and refactoring (etc. kwargs -> params)
* Backport of Python 2.7 method assertDictContainsSubset()

TODO:
* Take care of ad-hoc actions

Change-Id: Iab853124679be393237bfdaaffdc03e4b8f0d664

commit_message:
Raise Not Implemented error from V2 diagnostics API

In case any driver does not implement functionality of providing VM
diagnostics, HTTPNotImplemented error will be raised from driver.
Nova V2 API should catch the same and pass it with proper error message
for better debugging.

This patch catch & raise  HTTPNotImplemented exception for
V2 "os-server-diagnostics" API.

Adding UT also for the same.

Change-Id: I485d3487d01eba07e3c34f6ef9b5c707af54ebb7

commit_message:
Don't expose X-Auth-Token in heat CLI

Heat CLI exposes X-Auth-Token in debug mode. This patch replaces
X-Auth-Token's value with '{SHA1}<sha1oftoken>'. Some credentials
are exposed by keystoneclient as heatclient uses keystoneclient to
authenticate, it will be fixed in bug:100414.

Change-Id: Ic768af5a947535807ba449fb0aeb1eb98dac56e6
Partial-Bug: #1327019

subject: Remove unused/mutable default args
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6899, 'name': 'Sirushti Murugesan', 'email': 'sirushtim@gmail.com', 'username': 'sirushtim'}, {'_account_id': 9189, 'name': 'Anderson Mesquita', 'email': 'andersonvom@gmail.com', 'username': 'andersonvom'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-21 18:58:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove unused/mutable default args

Having mutable default args is a bad idea
(http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/#mutable-default-arguments).
Also, due to the decorators being used, the args object is always passed
and in some cases, passing a dict would even break the code.

Change-Id: Id941f259ff362f306582be5c2e4bdea133149491
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-22 17:44:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove unused/mutable default args

Having mutable default args is a bad idea
(http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/#mutable-default-arguments).
This patch removes all entries of mutable default args.

Change-Id: Id941f259ff362f306582be5c2e4bdea133149491

commit_message:
Remove unused/mutable default args

Having mutable default args is a bad idea
(http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/#mutable-default-arguments).

Change-Id: Id941f259ff362f306582be5c2e4bdea133149491

subject: Adds a state metric to ceilometer
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-27 04:39:14.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/pollsters/state.py', 'ceilometer/compute/vm_states.py', 'ceilometer/compute/notifications.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Adds a state metric to ceilometer

To allow accurate billing of VMs based on which state they are in,
this metric polls state on the pipeline interval, but also watches for
any instance events to ensure accurate state transition data.

A couple of new metrics were added (one for polling, and one for
notifications) that both return the same sample meter name. The
implementation is based on the way the instance metric currently
works.

Change-Id: I3c13d2ec149de93139482770bc56480a596731c2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adds a state metric to ceilometer

To allow accurate billing of VMs based on which state they are in,
this metric polls state on the pipeline interval, but also watches for
any instance events to ensure accurate state transition data.

A couple of new metrics were added (one for polling, and one for
notifications) that both return the same sample meter name. The
implementation is based on the way the instance metric currently
works.

Change-Id: I3c13d2ec149de93139482770bc56480a596731c2

commit_message:
Add and document $NOVA_VNC_ENABLED for forcing VNC on

This allows multinode setups to function correctly without enabling the
unneeded n-novnc and n-xvnc services on pure compute nodes.

Change-Id: Ie02734bb598d27560cf5d674c9e1d9b8dca3801f
Closes-Bug: 1342155

", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-07-15 00:37:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Enable changing volume type of a volume

Expose the functionality of the 'cinder retype' command in the UI.
It allows user to change the volume type of a volume whose status is
in-use or available when horizon's cinder API version is >= 2.

cinder retype is only supported in cinder v2. It depends on the
drivers (backends) that are associated with volume types. Volume types
are set up through type-key extra specs. During retype, if cinder
finds it can not retype, it will check if the migration policy is
one_demand or never. If the policy is never, then cinder does not do
anything, otherwise, it will do migration. By default, in the horizon
retype dialog UI, migration policy is never which is also the default
of the cinder cli command.

Implements: blueprint volume-retype
Change-Id: Id8bc539e1849f5910df34d7b76cc250ec82f9671

functionallity, you need to update

API to use version 2 so the "Change Volume Type" action menu
shows up for the volume:
OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS = {

}

shows up for the volume:

}

commit_message:
Enable changing volume type of a volume

Expose the functionality of the 'cinder retype' command in the UI.
It allows user to change the volume type of a volume whose status is
in-use or available when horizon's cinder API version is >= 2.

cinder retype is only supported starting cinder v2.

If enabled_backends is specified in /etc/cinder/cinder.conf,
retype is actually performed by a specific driver.
It depends on the drivers (backends) that are associated
with volume types.
Volume types are set through type-key extra specs.

If enabled_backends in cinder.conf is not specified, volumes are
created by LVM so retype is actually performaned in LVM.

During retype, if cinder finds it can not retype, it will check
if the migration policy is on_demand or never. If the policy is
is never, then cinder does not do anything, otherwise, it will
perform migration. By default, in the horizon retype dialog UI,
migration policy is never which is also the default
of the cinder cli command.

Currently in horizon cinder api default version is 1. In order to
test this functionallity, you need to update
openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py to have the "volume"
API to use version 2 so the "Change Volume Type" action menu
shows up for the volume. If local_settings.py is not available, you
need to copy the local_settings.py.example file, change it to
local_settings.py, update other necessary settings and also update
have the API version setting like the followings:

OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS = {
    #"data_processing": 1.1,
    #"identity": 3,
    "volume": 2
}

Implements: blueprint volume-retype

Change-Id: Id8bc539e1849f5910df34d7b76cc250ec82f9671

commit_message:
Refactor CreateRouter to use update_dict

At this point in time, 'distributed' is a positional argument and
thus doesn't need to be moved into the resource body.

Change-Id: I1d5c7c360fc76b5da9e145d70ce6d9e7a90d80bc

commit_message:
Add hook scripts for the functional infra job

Infra jobs support hooks to customize behavior.  This change adds
scripts that are intended to be called by the neutron-dsvm-functional
jobs as hooks.   Defining hook behavior in-tree instead of directly in
the job definition has the advantage of allowing changes in hook
behavior to be tested before merge.

The gate_hook.sh script added by this change installs a rootwrap
filter to allow functional tests to destroy python processes that
they have spawned.  The tests use the python executable provided by
their tox env, and the default rootwrap configuration does not
support killing processes launched by non-system python executables.

This change will have to merge to master and stable/icehouse before
the supporting infra config change can be merged:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/116458/

Partial-bug: #1360658
Change-Id: Idcc6195f91fac833c14892f27fb793048ef964b9
(cherry picked from commit 31ca6ea1412ca30c708f52ef844f5a2eedb7a56d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-29 03:36:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add visibility filter to datastore versions

Allows datastore versions to be hidden from all users except those
explicitly allowed by their tenant. Implemented via a visibility
attribute for datastore versions (defaulting to 'public'), and a
datastore version member table for controlling access to non-public
datastore versions by tenant.

This commit provides the client functionality for integration tests
related to the datastore-visibility feature.

Implements: blueprint datastore-visibility
Docimpact: change to datastore version payload
Change-Id: Ic8024a631530ba295688d7e49e895f50cb2f32ef
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-26 18:01:53.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/v1/datastores.py', 'troveclient/compat/client.py', 'troveclient/compat/exceptions.py'], 'message': "Add visibility filter to datastore versions

Allows datastore versions to be hidden from all users except those

attribute for datastore versions (defaulting to 'public'), and a

commit_message:
Add visibility filter to datastore versions

Allows datastore versions to be hidden from all users except those
explicitly allowed by their tenant. Implemented via a visibility
attribute for datastore versions (defaulting to 'public'), and a
datastore version member table for controlling access to non-public
datastore versions by tenant.

This commit provides the client functionality for integration tests
related to the datastore-visibility feature.

Implements: blueprint datastore-visibility
Docimpact: change to datastore version payload
Change-Id: Ic8024a631530ba295688d7e49e895f50cb2f32ef

commit_message:
Remove mention of Message objects from public docs

The Message class is not part of the public API of the library, so don't
refer to it in documentation that appears for the public API.

Change-Id: Ie28ce6f8f2c2de351c8a233b7de9dc31abaa9e04

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-10 15:05:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add Oracle ZFS Storage Appliance ISCSI Driver

ZFSSA ISCSI Driver is designed for ZFS Storage Appliance product
line (ZS3-2, ZS3-4, ZS3-ES, 7420 and 7320).
It uses REST API to communicate out of band with the storage controller
to perform the following:
* Create/Delete Volume
* Extend Volume
* Create/Delete Snapshot
* Create Volume from Snapshot
* Delete Volume Snapshot
* Attach/Detach Volume
* Get Volume Stats

Update cinder.conf.sample to include ZFS Storage Appliance
properties.

Change-Id: I2925c3e8cbe6f9d7a81ca70fcac7709714f07962
Implements: blueprint oracle-zfssa-cinder-driver

commit_message:
Add Oracle ZFS Storage Appliance ISCSI Driver

ZFSSA ISCSI Driver is designed for ZFS Storage Appliance product
line (ZS3-2, ZS3-4, ZS3-ES, 7420 and 7320).
It uses REST API to communicate out of band with the storage controller
to perform the following:
* Create/Delete Volume
* Extend Volume
* Create/Delete Snapshot
* Create Volume from Snapshot
* Delete Volume Snapshot
* Attach/Detach Volume
* Get Volume Stats
* Clone Volume

Update cinder.conf.sample to include ZFS Storage Appliance
properties.

Certification test results:
	https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1356075

Change-Id: I2925c3e8cbe6f9d7a81ca70fcac7709714f07962
Implements: blueprint oracle-zfssa-cinder-driver

commit_message:
Bump up zake to be using the newer 0.1 or greater

0.1 brings in quite a few new hotness than prior
to it. The big one is multi-client -> single storage
which mimics many zookeeper clients attached to
the same zookeeper.

commit_message:
Clean up image build script

This change allows the image build script to support the existing
jobs that build images for distribution, as well as future jobs that
build the image within devstack for testing.

commit_message:
Network: add in a new network type - DVS

The support enables DVS network backends. In this case neutron
will return a vif type of DVS.

The name of the VC port group will be of the following format:
    <network-name>-<network-uuid>

The network name is so that the prefix will be easy for people to
understand. The UUID is to ensure that it will be unique.

Change-Id: Id125797632591bd799e215da7cbae07154e90344

currently we let neutronclient authenticate against keystone. this
makes it impossible for us to figure out whether service is valid
until too late (when we call poll neutronclient).

commit_message:
fix network discovery meters

currently we let neutronclient authenticate against keystone. this
makes it impossible for us to figure out whether service is valid
until too late (when we call poll neutronclient).

this patch moves keystone validation to ceilometer's end so we can
check whether or not to poll neutron depending whether service is
registered or not. this makes it more inline with other polling
services.

Change-Id: If2768ad48b7e3f18af0c8111e15fc5243ec64f97
Closes-Bug: #1361818

try running the engine with a slightly older API version, or
have out-of-tree stuff using this RPC call (although I'm not
aware of any..), so maintain it for a transitional period (TBC,
maybe remove it after J2 has passed, or do we need to leave it
until K?)

Note the intention is to remove the metadata_update RPC call, but
maintain the metadata_update plugin interface (which is now only
used when it's necessary to do an internal refresh of the metadata
all external metadata update should happen via the resource_signal
interface, so it's compatible with the native API.

Change-Id: Idf79389bc4250f91959cc13ae5fe7513aff6f291

commit_message:
Mark metadata_update RPC call deprecated

Log a deprecation warning if the metadata_update call is used,
in theory nothing uses this now, but it's possible folks could
try running the engine with a slightly older API version, or
have out-of-tree stuff using this RPC call (although I'm not
aware of any..), so maintain it for a transitional period (TBC,
maybe remove it after J2 has passed, or do we need to leave it
until K?)

Note the intention is to remove the metadata_update RPC call, but
maintain the metadata_update plugin interface (which is now only
used when it's necessary to do an internal refresh of the metadata
all external metadata update should happen via the resource_signal
interface, so it's compatible with the native API.)

Change-Id: Idf79389bc4250f91959cc13ae5fe7513aff6f291

commit_message:

This reverts commit ac73660c4091d43d2750d269076d756cb30d9ca9.

This was a backwards incompatible change - it broke the stable tripleo-heat-templates job.

commit_message:
Update requirements.txt to include keystoneclient

Keystone client is required by nova client and needs to be in
requirements.txt. It is currently in test-requirements.txt but also
needs to be in install requirements.

Change Ief6cd7e752fd8c9e9157364f99e270da7faff074 introduced the
requirement for keystone client.

Change-Id: I91f58810e0511d0d4acc5bba0c0e946edf247896
Closes-Bug: 1358675

commit_message:
Should not send replies for cast messages

Cast messages will not contain a msg_id  and we're currently
sending messages to the default excahgne with empty msg_id.
In order to fix it we should not send replies if there is no
msg_id in message.

Change-Id: I5b1142029d2c718c3929cf6cf1f6e958b95a5c96
Closes-bug: #1355058

commit_message:
Back off initial migration to 34

Upgrading from the Havana release to Juno was failing because the
initial Juno migration didn't include a couple of migrations that
weren't in the initial Havana release but were added afterwards.

This change adds the 035 migration from Havana back in and moves
the initial Juno migration back to 034.

Change-Id: I012b3f707659557d1774bae78b1dd652bb1a4dd7
Closes-Bug: #1357498

commit_message:
Fix the conflict configuration on rabbitmq port

In current logic, rabbitmq port will be set to ssl-listening port,
this will make rabbitmq fail to start.
This submit will configure rabbitmq port for both ssl and non-ssl cases.

Closes-Bug: #1353884

Change-Id: I37dc9b656c553554b9bc636fe35c69744debe92a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-18 00:12:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/ml2/drivers/test_cisco_nexus_switch.py'], 'message': "Add a Cisco smoke test for testing plugins on actual Nexus switch

Fixes bug 1241262

This fix creates a Cisco smoke test for quickly testing Nexus plugin
operation (for both original Cisco Nexus plugin and the Cisco ML2
mechanism driver) operation on an actual Nexus switch.

The test requires SSH access to a Nexus switch which has
one ethernet interface available on which the user doesn't
mind VLANs being configured/unconfigured by the test.
In order to trigger the test to run, the user must provide
connection information for a Nexus switch (IP address,
username, password, and ethernet interface number).

The smoke test is based on existing Neutron unit tests.
If Nexus switch connection information is not provided,
the tests will default to being skipped.

Change-Id: I943fda97b4751b3687625121cda1ad9a82094337
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add a Cisco smoke test for testing plugins on actual Nexus switch

Fixes bug 1241262

This fix creates a Cisco smoke test for quickly testing Nexus plugin
operation (for both original Cisco Nexus plugin and the Cisco ML2
mechanism driver) operation on an actual Nexus switch.

The test requires SSH access to a Nexus switch which has
one ethernet interface available on which the user doesn't
mind VLANs being configured/unconfigured by the test.
In order to trigger the test to run, the user must provide
connection information for a Nexus switch (IP address,
username, password, and ethernet interface number).

The smoke test is based on existing Neutron unit tests.
If Nexus switch connection information is not provided,
the tests will default to being skipped.

Change-Id: I943fda97b4751b3687625121cda1ad9a82094337

commit_message:
Fix performance issues with brocade zone driver.

Removed firmware checks from common path as the ssh invoke_shell was taking 5 seconds to complete for each firmware check. Refactored to only do cfgsave in non-activate case. Removed extra calls to switch to get the active zoneset.

Closes-Bug: #1292119 (cherry-picked from commit: 371a58fd1d3fb1c2db7e1234f9c51f22b1b8787e) Change-Id: Ie1c2c0c603f6dd68439f2c2db74b21ea2dd0fc11

Change-Id: Ie0f1694517ca2ce3e1164a2eca8b933864a60045

commit_message:
Merged Fix performance issues with brocade zone driver.

Cherry-pick from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/97884/

Change-Id: I4ed108625416b42abd390e6aa227e97d4ebf8d7c

When i ran "./run_tests.sh -p zonemanager" command, i got a recommendation that the etc/cinder/cinder.conf.samples
file is not upto date. Hence i had run the " ./tools/config/generate_sample.sh" commnad. But it didn't update the file instead it deleted contents of the file. Hence i had restored the file in patch.

fc_zone_manager.py: Revereted the _build_driver method changes that are not required.
test_fc_zone_manager.py: Reverted the file to it's original state it had before this defect fix. As these changes are not required as per the orinal owner of the juno defect fix.

Change-Id: I4ed108625416b42abd390e6aa227e97d4ebf8d7c

commit_message:
Moved context creation to benchmark.engine

Before this patch, context was created in benchmark.runner
base. This patch moved context creation to benchmark.engine.

This change makes the architecture of Rally much cleaner.
e.g. runners don't know anything about benchmark context
(removing one dependency in code)

Another reason for this change is to work on phasing out
hardcoded "users" from required context objects. On the
benchmark.engine level, we have more information about
deployment (so we can choose to use this context or not
depending on what we are doing, e.g. loading with
pre-created users or without them)

Change-Id: I6d60e3563011840a13140ad345a819d2c0b8db1e

commit_message:
Refactored user creation code.

Moved user creation from /runners/base.py
to engine.py within the benchmark folder.
This will fix the duplication of users when trying
to use existing test users while running scenarios.

Change-Id: I7f55d4aab146cc28fd4940ee799b286f862a0164

'dogpile.cache.memcache'.

commit_message:
Make BaseValidationTestCase

Other parts of the Keystone API will need to extend this, so naming it
Base makes more sense. Also adding module level variables for valid and
invalide enabled types as well as creating a update schema validator
object that can be extended in subsequent validation test patches.

Change-Id: I2ffaa784d2bf1e0d785fa1b371b404b4dfd0ac13
bp: api-validation

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-26 17:33:44.000000000', 'files': ['labs/config/scripts.controller', 'labs/lib/osbash/functions.host', 'labs/config/scripts.compute', 'labs/config/scripts.network'], 'message': 'labs: add snapshot_cycle command

This changeset adds the new command, snapshot_cycle. It can be used to
replace four lines that often go together. The command handles a full
cycle needed for a snapshot: queueing shutdown.sh, booting the VM,

Change-Id: I13276088bd44326f475bf7477ad2ed27db2dbbe9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
labs: add snapshot_cycle command

This changeset adds the new command, snapshot_cycle. It can be used to
replace four lines that often go together. The command handles a full
cycle needed for a snapshot: queueing shutdown.sh, booting the VM,
waiting for it to shutdown, and taking a snapshot.

Change-Id: I13276088bd44326f475bf7477ad2ed27db2dbbe9

commit_message:
Update keystone conf files for Juno

* Update paste.ini
* Update keystone.conf
  - Add in description comments
  - Add project_ for deprecated ldap tenant_
  - Remove unused user and group _domain_id_attributes
* Update specs as needed

Change-Id: Ifbd5fac220fff7723b3de349ca57cd96a4b6910a
Closes-bug: #1351459

This changeset adds an environment variable and an option that can be
used to change the type of VirtualBox VM GUI used while building the
nodes.

Valid values are gui (default), sdl (minimal gui), and headless.

The resulting node VMs can then be started with or without GUI as

Change-Id: If12f4ba6dc455972b6332318ed1261e2c9de8c3f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
labs: add option for VM gui type

This changeset adds an environment variable and an option that can be
used to change the type of VirtualBox VM GUI used while building the
nodes.

Valid values are gui (default), sdl (minimal gui), and headless.

The resulting node VMs can then be started with or without GUI as
before.

Change-Id: If12f4ba6dc455972b6332318ed1261e2c9de8c3f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7007, 'name': 'Pranav Salunke', 'email': 'dguitarbite@gmail.com', 'username': 'dguitarbite'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-26 17:33:44.000000000', 'files': ['labs/lib/osbash/virtualbox.functions', 'labs/osbash.sh'], 'message': 'labs: add export via clone VM directory

This changeset introduces a new export method: exporting the named node
VMs as clones to the img directory.

The -e option takes now an argument (ova or dir) to distinguish between
exporting to an OVA package file and exporting to the img directory.

Unlike the OVA package files, this method preserves snapshots.

The resulting vbox files can be imported as VMs via VirtualBox GUI
(Machine->Add).

Change-Id: I7a8801de4b69796f3291a9e3a5896a055859121f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
labs: add export via clone VM directory

This changeset introduces a new export method: exporting the named node
VMs as clones to the img directory.

The -e option takes now an argument (ova or dir) to distinguish between
exporting to an OVA package file and exporting to the img directory.

Unlike the OVA package files, this method preserves snapshots.

The resulting vbox files can be imported as VMs via VirtualBox GUI
(Machine->Add).

Change-Id: I7a8801de4b69796f3291a9e3a5896a055859121f

Osbash only accepts commands for the cluster or a single node. With this

Change-Id: I8d178268f683ad70dbf275b75582acb05e7577ca
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
labs: allow node selection

Osbash only accepts commands for the cluster or a single node. With this
patch, any set of nodes can be passed as arguments to osbash.sh.

Change-Id: I8d178268f683ad70dbf275b75582acb05e7577ca

commit_message:
Move endpoint group filter to Kilo

Since we have moved passed the FPF date and there is currently
no implementation, we should move this feature to Kilo.

Change-Id: I20408f4f1044461984fe79415972fa93c6bd9dcf

Update OS-EP-FILTER API

new Endpoint Grouping APIs.

Related spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102023/

[{'created': '2014-04-04 19:16:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add importable SwiftService incorporating shell.py logic

This patch adds a SwiftService class that incorporates the high
level logic from swiftclient/shell.py. It also ports shell.py to
use the new class, and updates the code in swiftclient/multithreading.py
to allow the SwiftService to be used for multiple operations whilst
using only one thread pool.

Change-Id: I08c5796b4c01001d79fd571651c3017c16462ffd

commit_message:
Add importable SwiftService incorporating shell.py logic

This patch adds a SwiftService class that incorporates the high
level logic from swiftclient/shell.py. It also ports shell.py to
use the new class, and updates the code in swiftclient/multithreading.py
to allow the SwiftService to be used for multiple operations whilst
using only one thread pool.

Currently, code that imports swiftclient has to have its own logic for
things like creating large objects, parallel uploads, and parallel
downloads. This patch adds a SwiftService class that makes that
functionality available in Python code as well as through the shell.

Change-Id: I08c5796b4c01001d79fd571651c3017c16462ffd
Implements: blueprint bin-swift-logic-as-importable-library

commit_message:
labs: make export a separate operation

Export is currently only possible at the end of a node rebuild.

With this patch, export becomes a separate operation that can be
executed at any time without changing the cluster.

Change-Id: I3e0780ef7264577a0c90e53bb7bf6f7079de88ec

commit_message:
Renewing ATC exceptions for Horizon

Jaromir and Liz have continued to provide significant UX input and
design for features being contributed to Horizon. Several features
reflect their contributions. The project would suffer without their
ongoing contribution and I would like their efforts to be formally
recognized.

Change-Id: I63884702da5ccc02d3ee0b0a0a2d9c35a13e3a70

commit_message:
Allow providing a default value to CLI loading

Allow users to specify a default value to loading auth plugins from the
CLI so that you can fallback to some default behaviour if the user
doesn't specify a plugin.

Change-Id: I44eb838f7ccc3b377dd1ba53dbb941e973e4a22e

[{'created': '2014-08-25 18:06:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove devstack-gate from projects

Repo devstack-gate has a requirements file but no setup.py, so we cannot
gate for changes there. Remove it from the list so that a broken
file will not break the requirements post job.

Change-Id: I19049439e497f549313fe162ded2f696f679ec8c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-26 13:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['projects.txt'], 'message': 'Remove devstack/devstack-gate from projects

Repo devstack-gate has a requirements file but no setup.py, so we cannot
gate for changes there. Remove it from the list so that a broken
file will not break the requirements post job.
Similar for devstack.

', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove devstack/devstack-gate from projects

Repo devstack-gate has a requirements file but no setup.py, so we cannot
gate for changes there. Remove it from the list so that a broken
file will not break the requirements post job.
Similar for devstack.

commit_message:
Add mysql devel as testonly alongside mysql-server

Neutron needs to be able to install MySQL-python in the functional
test job, which requires devstack to install mysql devel libraries as
testonly.

As per sdague's recommendation mysql devel libraries are now installed
for nova as well.  In the future, any service that installs
mysql-server should also install mysql devel libraries for consistency.

Related-bug: #1346444

Change-Id: Ie715841e33a2c2d31cb4ac724b302eb98ed3366a

commit_message:
Use empty list in list_join for validation

Calling list_join on the list of ResourceGroup's attributes in a
SoftwareConfig fails during template validation with:

ERROR: Property error : my_config: config "list_join" must operate on a
list

Closes-Bug: 1358831
Change-Id: I39d2da7a28ba53fbe3a95bff0198fa5c2f87aa3b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 7148, 'name': 'Zhu Zhu', 'email': 'bjzzu.zz@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhuzhubj'}, {'_account_id': 8784, 'name': 'Gordon Sim', 'email': 'gsim@redhat.com', 'username': 'gordonsim'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-07 09:36:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add parameter to customize Qpid receiver capacity

In Qpid rpc backend, receiver capacity is 1 and is hardcoding.
User can not customize it. This patch adds a parameter to make
user can specify receiver capacity in conf file.

- Reference about Receiver Capacity(Prefetch) from Qpid Doc
By default, receiver requests the next message from the server
in response to each fetch call, resulting in messages being
sent to the receiver one at a time. As in the case of sending,
it is often desirable to avoid this roundtrip for each message.
This can be achieved by allowing the receiver to prefetch messages
in anticipation of fetch calls being made. The receiver needs to
be able to store these prefetched messages, the number it can hold
is controlled by the receivers capacity.

Change-Id: I966b512aba6bdd8e9c5cf65cae01bfd21f04f330
Closes-Bug: #1353914

commit_message:
Add parameter to customize Qpid receiver capacity

In Qpid rpc backend, receiver capacity is 1 and is hardcoding.
User can not customize it. This patch adds a parameter to make
user can specify receiver capacity in conf file.

- Reference about Receiver Capacity(Prefetch) from Qpid Doc
By default, receiver requests the next message from the server
in response to each fetch call, resulting in messages being
sent to the receiver one at a time. As in the case of sending,
it is often desirable to avoid this roundtrip for each message.
This can be achieved by allowing the receiver to prefetch messages
in anticipation of fetch calls being made. The receiver needs to
be able to store these prefetched messages, the number it can hold
is controlled by the receivers capacity.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I966b512aba6bdd8e9c5cf65cae01bfd21f04f330
Closes-Bug: #1353914

commit_message:
VPNaaS: Enable UT cases with newer oslo.messaging

Now that 1.4.0.0a3 of oslo.messaging has been added to Neutron
requirements, the unit test cases in VPNaaS code can be
uncommented and included in the tests. These tests ensure that
the correct validator is called, when validation is performed.
This adds similar tests to the reference and Cisco VPNaaS
implementation.

Change-Id: I62e3f8f3ec5fcceccd13891b1aa142869e1d88a1
Closes-Bug: 1349829

[{'created': '2014-01-15 16:42:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "libvirt: VM diagnostics (v3 API only)

There is no formal definition for the VM diagnostics. For the
V2 API the diagnostics will be returned as they are today.

For the V3 api the diagnostics will have the format defined at:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Nova_VM_Diagnostics

This will support backward compatibility with the existing API's.

Part of the blueprint v3-diagnostics

DocImpact

commit_message:
libvirt: VM diagnostics (v3 API only)

There is no formal definition for the VM diagnostics. For the
V2 API the diagnostics will be returned as they are today.

This will support backward compatibility with the existing API's.

Part of the blueprint v3-diagnostics

DocImpact

Change-Id: I4128e76622e73a40d25fb50b10b1c1ac710a5cc4

[{'created': '2014-08-08 02:17:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adding template attribute for Nuage plugin

subnet create and router create commands now gives the ability
to the user to create subnets and routers via neutron cli with
additional attributes nuage_subnet_template and nuage_router_template
respectively. The instantiated subnet and router inherits the properties
of the template that was mentioned in the additinal parameters.

Change-Id: Ib73313e840cb35ede89df858baa536aab883efa2
Closes-Bug: #1353112

commit_message:
Add template attr. for subnet, router create in Nuage plugin

subnet create and router create commands now gives the ability
to the user to create subnets and routers via neutron cli with
additional attributes nuage_subnet_template and nuage_router_template
respectively. The instantiated subnet and router inherits the properties
of the template that was mentioned in the additional parameters.

Change-Id: Ib73313e840cb35ede89df858baa536aab883efa2
Closes-Bug: #1353112

commit_message:
5.1 Release Notes

Copied release-notes/v5-0 to v5.1

Has been marked for Beta in release table
050-known-issues includes link to LaunchPad for all issues;
  the list is not ready for Beta

Deleted 019-new-features and 039-resolved-issues from v5-1 directory
(they were added especially for 5.0.1)

Added v5-1-icehouse-full.rst

v5-1/020-new-features contains list of new features

v5-1/030-other-enhancements contains additional improvements and a linke
to the 5.1 blueprint summary page.

v5-1/040-resolved-issues now includes items for 5.0.1 known issues
that have been fixed in 5.1

v5-1/050-known-issues now includes 5.0.1 known issues that have not
been fixed for 5.1

Change-Id: Id825efaced949a9e264ab20f18b9a837e1452c70

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-22 21:09:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add the ability to benchmark across multiple queues

Previously, all operations where performed on a single queue. This patch
introduces the ability to distribute operations across multiple queues,
which is important to measure since we know that the mongod driver has
some per-queue performance limits, but that it has several features
which allow for scaling load by spreading it across multiple queues.

Note that the default of 4 queues was chosen somewhat arbitrarily, and
may be adjusted later as we gather more data.

As part of this patch, queue classes and sample messages were hoisted
so they can be shared across all greenlets. Sharing a requests
session across all workers should improve the performance of the
benchmarking tool itself.

commit_message:
Add the ability to benchmark across multiple queues

Previously, all operations where performed on a single queue. This patch
introduces the ability to distribute operations across multiple queues,
which is important to measure since we know that the mongod driver has
some per-queue performance limits, but that it has several features
which allow for scaling load by spreading it across multiple queues.

Note that the default of 4 queues was chosen somewhat arbitrarily, and
may be adjusted later as we gather more data.

As part of this patch, queue classes and sample messages were hoisted
so they can be shared across all greenlets. Sharing a requests
session across all workers should improve the performance of the
benchmarking tool itself.

Change-Id: Iac6625b0214d40156da1c2bebe738fa453f184d1

commit_message:
Fix divide by zero bug in benchmark workers

This change checks for a zero denominator before attempting the
relevant calculations, otherwise allowing the statistic to
default to zero.

commit_message:
Make use of openvswitch elements

Neutron and network-utils elements now depends of the new
openvswitch elements and delegate all openvswitch installation
and configuration into the openvswitch elements.

Closes-Bug: #1316985
Change-Id: Ib5c18e85317e6120b420d21790c26c21f4bbb0e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-25 20:41:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages

When a ProcessExecutionError is thrown by processutils.execute(), the
exception may contain information such as password. Upstream
applications that just log the message (as several appear to do) could
inadvertently expose these passwords to a user with read access to the
log files. It is therefore considered prudent to invoke
strutils.mask_password() on the command, stdout and stderr in the
exception. A test case has been added to ensure that all three are
properly masked.

Cherry-pick from review.openstack.org/109417
Partial-Bug: #1343604

Change-Id: I5902391e244a2cb6012a0fafa2dd58e8830e80e3

commit_message:
Mask passwords in exceptions and error messages

When a ProcessExecutionError is thrown by processutils.execute(), the
exception may contain information such as password. Upstream
applications that just log the message (as several appear to do) could
inadvertently expose these passwords to a user with read access to the
log files. It is therefore considered prudent to invoke
strutils.mask_password() on the command, stdout and stderr in the
exception.

Cherry-pick from review.openstack.org/109417
Cherry-pick from review.openstack.org/116763
Partial-Bug: #1343604

Change-Id: I5902391e244a2cb6012a0fafa2dd58e8830e80e3

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-25 20:31:55.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/openstack/common/strutils.py'], 'message': 'Make strutils.mask_password more secure

Make some enhancements to strutils.mask_password to allow it to catch
more cases of passwords in strings. Test cases have been added to test
for these newly added situations.

The following is a listing of patterns that will be handled. The
keyword that mask_password uses (a list of four now) is represented by
<key> and the password is shown as <password>. Quotes (both single and
double) are represented as <quote>.

--<key> <password>
--<key> <quote><password><quote>
<key> = <password>
<key> = <quote><password><quote>

All existing tests and patterns are still handled.

Cherry-pick from review.openstack.org/113407
Partial-Bug: #1345233

Change-Id: If8a08c5248dec4e5d0860cce9e8d2266f7d49e38
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make strutils.mask_password more secure

Make some enhancements to strutils.mask_password to allow it to catch
more cases of passwords in strings. Test cases have been added to test
for these newly added situations.

The following is a listing of patterns that will be handled. The
keyword that mask_password uses (a list of four now) is represented by
<key> and the password is shown as <password>. Quotes (both single and
double) are represented as <quote>.

--<key> <password>
--<key> <quote><password><quote>
<key> = <password>
<key> = <quote><password><quote>

All existing tests and patterns are still handled.

Cherry-pick from review.openstack.org/113407
Partial-Bug: #1345233

Change-Id: If8a08c5248dec4e5d0860cce9e8d2266f7d49e38

Removing the XML info from the docs

We don't support XML anymore, so these need to go.

Closes-Bug: 1361381

subject: Fix legacy tests using system policy.json file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 11356, 'name': 'Louis Taylor', 'email': 'louis@kragniz.eu', 'username': 'kragniz'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-25 16:52:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix legacy tests using system policy.json file

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new file named '/etc/glance/policy.json' and inside it
paste:

    {"context_is_admin":  "role:admin"}

2. Run tests. Some of the tests under glance.tests.integration
.legacy_functional.test_v1_api will fail with errors such as
'MismatchError: 403 != 201'. These tests will pass without policy.json
in place.

The outcome of the tests should be isolated from the surrounding
environment, so this patch sets policy.json to be the one under the
tests directory (glance/tests/etc/policy.json) to avoid this problem.

Change-Id: I27903ee4ebb7bad243c4f1b2d01096bfb93f1008
Closes-Bug: 1184056
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-26 09:56:19.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/integration/legacy_functional/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix legacy tests using system policy.json file

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new file named '/etc/glance/policy.json' and inside it
paste:

    {"context_is_admin":  "role:admin"}

2. Run tests. Some of the tests under glance.tests.integration
.legacy_functional.test_v1_api will fail with errors such as
'MismatchError: 403 != 201'. These tests will pass without policy.json
in place.

The outcome of the tests should be isolated from the surrounding
environment, so this patch copies policy.json from glance's data files
(glance/tests/etc/policy.json) into the tests directory to avoid this
problem.

Change-Id: I27903ee4ebb7bad243c4f1b2d01096bfb93f1008
Closes-Bug: 1184056
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix legacy tests using system policy.json file

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new file named '/etc/glance/policy.json' and inside it
paste:

    {"context_is_admin":  "role:admin"}

2. Run tests. Some of the tests under glance.tests.integration
.legacy_functional.test_v1_api will fail with errors such as
'MismatchError: 403 != 201'. These tests will pass without policy.json
in place.

The outcome of the tests should be isolated from the surrounding
environment, so this patch copies policy.json from glance's data files
(glance/tests/etc/policy.json) into the tests directory to avoid this
problem.

Change-Id: I27903ee4ebb7bad243c4f1b2d01096bfb93f1008
Closes-Bug: 1184056

commit_message:
Change autogenerate to be unconditional

Template for generating db migration scripts are now not run according
to used plugins. Target environment is set to use all available models
but also used plugins are kept for backward compatibility.

Part of this patch is script that will drop unused tables to avoid
generating the drop in future migration scripts.

Change-Id: I90a7d3416de24f2317ccdeb828bb8bd973ee5e61
Closes-bug: #1346638

subject: Avoid refreshing PCI devices on instance.save()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6685, 'name': 'Baodong (Robert) Li', 'email': 'baoli@cisco.com', 'username': 'baoli'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-23 00:39:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_instance.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py'], 'message': "Avoid refreshing PCI devices on instance.save()

Currently the way we refresh Instance.pci_devices causes current-version
PciDevice and PciDeviceList objects to be sent back to a potentially old
client. This is because remotable methods don't undergo backporting
obligatorily in the way that remotable_classmethod ones do. This is
currently a problem for pci_devices and security_groups, although it is
handled differently for things like info_cache so that it's not a
problem.

The resolution to this is rather complicated, so this patch just avoids
the implicit update (which is probably never used and actually generating
some more DB traffic) for the time being.

Change-Id: I33e584c42c9484912ccc3d38b67a6a7ee3d69a10
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Avoid refreshing PCI devices on instance.save()

Currently the way we refresh Instance.pci_devices causes current-version
PciDevice and PciDeviceList objects to be sent back to a potentially old
client. This is because remotable methods don't undergo backporting
obligatorily in the way that remotable_classmethod ones do. This is
currently a problem for pci_devices and security_groups, although it is
handled differently for things like info_cache so that it's not a
problem.

The resolution to this is rather complicated, so this patch just avoids
the implicit update (which is probably never used and actually generating
some more DB traffic) for the time being.

Change-Id: I33e584c42c9484912ccc3d38b67a6a7ee3d69a10

commit_message:
Fix Python 3 testing

Raising SkipTest at import time fails in recent version of the test
suite. We change that by being more picky at one should or should not be
tested based on what we managed to import; the upside is that we test a
few more things under Python 3 now.

Change-Id: I8971c7291cb261faf00fec73cf53b6132bdaf948

http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/juno/keystone-to-keystone-federation.html

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-08-18 15:40:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Revoke by Audit Id / Audit Id Chain instead of expires

Instead of using the expiry of the token which can collide (is non
unique in some/many cases) use the new Audit ID for the tokens when
revoking a single token via the token revocation events.

Support for revoking by the audit_chain_id has been added to the
token provider, however, the REST API has not been updated to
accept an argument to revoke the chain. Support for revoking
the entire chain is in place to allow Keystone to internally
revoke an entire chain in certain circumstances. Exposing the
ability to revoke the entire chain via the REST API may occur
based upon further design discussions.

Change-Id: I840355ccd9bcfcd88aa139184731c056808c2c8f

revoke an entire chain in certain circumstances. Exposing the
ability to revoke the entire chain via the REST API may occur
based upon further design discussions.

Change-Id: I840355ccd9bcfcd88aa139184731c056808c2c8f

commit_message:
Revoke by Audit Id / Audit Id Chain instead of expires

Instead of using the expiry of the token which can collide (is non
unique in some/many cases) use the new Audit ID for the tokens when
revoking a single token via the token revocation events.

Support for revoking by the audit_chain_id has been added to the
token provider, however, the REST API has not been updated to
accept an argument to revoke the chain. Support for revoking
the entire chain is in place to allow Keystone to internally
revoke an entire chain in certain circumstances. Exposing the
ability to revoke the entire chain via the REST API may occur
based upon further design discussions.

Change-Id: I840355ccd9bcfcd88aa139184731c056808c2c8f
bp: non-persistent-tokens
Closes-Bug: 1292283

commit_message:
Share unittest between v2 and v2.1 for hide_server_addresses extension

This patch make the v2.1 hide_server_addresses extension running on v2
unittest, also delete the v3 unittest.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I9b8e8d10ba59b344d5bdf285fffffd98ed02ebc0

commit_message:
bump pycadf to 0.6.0

v0.6.0 introduces support for a federated credential model, which is
required for keystone to emit audit notifications during federated
authentication in bp audit-support-for-federation

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-26 00:36:39.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add flake8 2.2.3

Flake8 2.2.2 didn't actually turn concurrency on by default, flake8
2.2.3 does.

The move to flake8 2.2.3 is done in two steps since our
global-requirements system does now allow for non-overlapping changes.

Bug: https://bitbucket.org/tarek/flake8/issue/163/
Change-Id: I676dbf2402922112923d63a98b1aae85abe0331a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add flake8 2.2.3

Flake8 2.2.2 didn't actually turn concurrency on by default, flake8
2.2.3 does.

The move to flake8 2.2.3 is done in two steps since our
global-requirements system does now allow for non-overlapping changes.

Bug: https://bitbucket.org/tarek/flake8/issue/163/
Change-Id: I676dbf2402922112923d63a98b1aae85abe0331a

commit_message:
Add Pint for Horizon

Add the Pint package to global requirements. It is needed for unit
conversion support in Horizon's charts:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/96800/

Pint project homepage: http://pint.readthedocs.org/
GitHub repo: https://github.com/hgrecco/pint

Pint is a pure python package without any external dependencies.
It is python3 compliant and has BSD license.

Partially implements: blueprint ceilometer-api-statistics-decorators-and-convertors

Change-Id: Ic9683c7a28cb9db008a974cde2daa57c9abcad61

commit_message:
memcached: switch leader election implementation to a lock

We reuse our lock code to manage the leader election, a.k.a. eat our own
dog food.

This also fixes the issue that all lock were not released when stop()
was called.

Change-Id: Ibbec3e8ac29d55247ec3b1b8941d5a9569b67677

commit_message:
Change v3 admin-password to v2.1

This patch changes v3 admin-password API to v2.1 and backport v3
unit test cases to v2.1.
The differences between v2 and v3 are described on the wiki page
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api
Change-Id: I167753eddd188120236c51bade549c907c8a8466

commit_message:
Adding quotas on alarms

+ Quotas can be set at a user level or a project level
+ Quotas are set via config options
+ Quotas default values are None (unlimited) for backward compatibility
+ Creates a new client side error OverQuota that is raised when the
  quota is reached
+ If OverQuota is raised, return a HTTP 403 (forbidden) response.

Change-Id: Ib9876013f8eb930875a91699a6b3314f8f1b1b47
Implements: blueprint quotas-on-alarms
Co-Authored-By: Ala Rezmerita <ala.rezmerita@cloudwatt.com>

commit_message:
Update environment statuses

* Do not create session in case of observing environment applications
* Forbid redeployment after failed deploy since it's not working
* Do not show 'Deploy Environment' when environment status is 'ready'

Change-Id: I90a673d82c528ea9f05dfe1967d6c5d3d1df228c
Closes-Bug: #1342404

commit_message:
Upgrades, fix iptables cleaning in docker engine

Rules should be cleaned after we start
new container via supervisor because
after containers creation we stop all
of the containers and start them again
under supervisor.

Change-Id: I6272b2fd93f1180cddb15f7a4ceca4d1c55d02b7
Related-bug: #1349287

commit_message:
Support Neutron DVR installation

To facilitate support for Neutron DVR, it will be necessary to
install the neutron-l3-agent and neutron-metadata-agent on the
compute nodes.  This change pulls installation of the l3-agent
and metadata-agent out from the neutron-network-node element to
a new 'neutron-router' element which does not list a dependency
on the neutron-dhcp-agent element.  In this way, the neutron-
router element can be specified for the compute node image build
when supporting Neutron DVR.

Additionally, some new configuration values need to be added in
the neutron.conf, l3_agent.ini and ml2_conf.ini image elements to
add needed parameter settings.

Change-Id: Ia9e71ebe3cfcb7b5be54d11b7852177911d69239

commit_message:
Fix dump_cib method for corosync service provider

Corosync_service.rb is missing block_until_ready() call
in its dump_cib method. That might result in empty xml result.

Closes-bug: #1355816

Change-Id: I757522b297e0025cee7de3130743e0ef6a6fb77b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add hook scripts for the functional infra job

Infra jobs support hooks to customize behavior.  This change adds
scripts that are intended to be called by the neutron-dsvm-functional
jobs as hooks.   Defining hook behavior in-tree instead of directly in
the job definition has the advantage of allowing changes in hook
behavior to be tested before merge.

The gate_hook.sh script added by this change installs a rootwrap
filter to allow functional tests to destroy python processes that
they have spawned.  The tests use the python executable provided by
their tox env, and the default rootwrap configuration does not
support killing processes launched by non-system python executables.

This change will have to merge to master and stable/icehouse before
the supporting infra config change can be merged:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/116458/

Partial-bug: #1360658
Change-Id: Idcc6195f91fac833c14892f27fb793048ef964b9

commit_message:
Fix HA mode troubles with Heat

HAProxy configuration doesn't include Heat services CFN and
Cloudwatch API (on port 8000 and 8003) as a result this services
unavailable via public interface.

Change-Id: Iafb5c119445e37e85b2f0d95b38aaee3b2e14b45
Closes-bug: #1353348

commit_message:
Use standard mysql package instead wsrep version for zabbix

commit_message:
Fix post_start_hooks entry point, add purge to setup hook

post_start_hooks was calling post_setup_hooks,
which is a misnomer. post_setup_hooks should also
call purge because it is necessary during upgrades.

Change-Id: Ic8731f185338b6febd9c543f837ffed2abec80a5
Partial-Bug: #1349287

commit_message:
SoftwareDeployments move signal reason into resource plugin

Move the determination of the signal reason string inside the resource
plugin so we don't need the resource-specific details handling in the
base-class.

Related-Bug: #1340894

commit_message:
Move sanity checks out of pep tox env

Moves check_uptodate and check_for_alembic_branches
to their own tox environments, so the pep8 check only
checks for flake8 compliance.

The other checks are still available, albeit in their own
respective environments. By naming them in the envlist,
they will still run when "tox" on its own is called.

Change-Id: Ie054c6465f126bb90d99cc6d3abab5dad38509aa
Closes-Bug: #1327393

commit_message:
Enabling Heat provisioning based on ENV for Trove

Reasons:
 - Trove can use Heat as resource delivery service.
   Heat support can be enabled by setting
   `use_heat=True` in trove-taskmanager.conf,
   in [DEFAULT] section;
 - required for bulding Trove gate with enabled Heat-provisioning.

Changes:
 - adding HEAT_PROVISIONING_SUPPORT variable in lib/trove
   that relays on ENV variable HEAT_PROVISIONING_SUPPORT;
 - if HEAT_PROVISIONING_SUPPORT is not set - use False by the default.
 - added description at samples/local.conf

Change-Id: Ie0426cd0113db5f9513bafa8c0f4bd3004eaa1a1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-26 12:57:14.000000000', 'files': ['labs/config/config.compute'], 'message': "labs: increase RAM allocation for compute node

Running a default instance on the compute node uses 512 MB RAM, which is
all of the compute node's RAM.

This patch increases the RAM allocation for the compute node to 1024 MB,
enabling it to run an instance.

Change-Id: I59ef85b2680f8b68d08108d738e03a964457680c
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
labs: increase RAM allocation for compute node

Running a default instance on the compute node uses 512 MB RAM, which is
all of the compute node's RAM.

This patch increases the RAM allocation for the compute node to 1024 MB,
enabling it to run an instance.

Change-Id: I59ef85b2680f8b68d08108d738e03a964457680c

commit_message:
Trying to ingore races related to Nova + restoring missing benchmark

Seems like Nova has some fix related to checking default security group
to avoid it we can add more tenants in 2 benchmarks that are failing
boot_and_bounce_server and boot_and_resize

Restore nova-boot with nics
