commit_message:
labs: fix getopts use in osbash.sh

For invalid options, $opt contains a literal '?' rather than the option
itself. This patch disables the builtin error message, which gets us
the invalid option passed as OPTARG.

Change-Id: I3b0d3d85e6c95f1839eed19679bf4d8af378cc29

commit_message:
skip polls if service is not registered

currently, when any pollster runs against a service that is not
registered in Keystone, it will throw an exception. we should
catch and skip these polls

Change-Id: I2b582b22a44182ab31d44ce459cc6d642cc3719d
Closes-Bug: #1337293

and anyone could add a malformed URL.

commit_message:
Install files properly

It's not a good idea to install files/* to /etc/httpd/conf.d/ because
all elements get copied into one place, so this could copy unexpected files.

Instead copy files individually, from a fully-structured path in files/,
to minimise the chance of filename collisions.

This issue was observed during CI of
I95da168ee56ef05ea7a75db2135bebd642b13588.

Change-Id: Ib792afb2b011da9f18d4ef2a1deacbc5f9d57d11

commit_message:
Hide multicast related attributes

Attributes for multicast should be hidden for user
because multicast verification is disabled for 5.1

I prefer not to delete it to avoid additional data
migration in 6.0 release

Change-Id: I7e601b65499ddbecd566b4597290de18284f9006
Closes-Bug: 1360018

commit_message:
Disable sshd GSSAPI auth

GSSAPI is not currently implemented in Fuel, so
it only slows incoming SSH connections. Disabling
it will enhance user experience.

Change-Id: I935e7c383e24663296c938e32b12682086d6797b
Closes-Bug: #1327988

commit_message:
Fix HA mode troubles with Heat

HAProxy configuration doesn't include Heat services CFN and
Cloudwatch API (on port 8000 and 8003) as a result this services
unavailable via public interface.

Change-Id: Iafb5c119445e37e85b2f0d95b38aaee3b2e14b45
Closes-bug: #1353348

commit_message:
Force volumes to rebuild after cluster reset

* rewritten `reset_environment_resp` to use objects
* after each cluster reset volumes configuration will be rebuild
  to prevent issues when disks identifiers will change
  after reset

Change-Id: I518a2ad36248b9a676455e8f43ac9f3f76515871
Closes-Bug: #1359070
Closes-Bug: #1360248

commit_message:
Consolidated devstack script

Based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/110988/

One script to run tests on devstack for both murano components:
* murano-engine
* murano-dashboard
* python-muranoclient

Nodepool preparation script included.

Use separate tests for murano-dashboard because of a bug in horizon
    https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1351298

Change-Id: I4f424cca68f0dcce8a1052f61703f4dc9891cb97

subject: Exit rabbitmq container if puppet apply fails

[{'created': '2014-08-26 12:05:22.000000000', 'files': ['docker/rabbitmq/start.sh'], 'message': "Exit rabbitmq container if puppet apply fails

Puppet now runs for rabbitmq container with
detailed exitcodes, allowing us to fail start

commit_message:
Exit rabbitmq container if puppet apply fails

Puppet now runs for rabbitmq container with
detailed exitcodes, allowing us to fail start
of container with start.sh. Sometimes restarting
the container will resolve rare issues where
rabbitmq service doesn't start from its init script.

Change-Id: I108cc4521fa7e193c68ede466b5829ad33464224
Closes-Bug: #1358972

[{'created': '2014-08-22 16:37:43.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Update stack-preview usage text

`--timeout` during stack-preview is only used in certain validation
paths and `--enable-rollback` is not used at all except to be consistent
with stack-create.  This changes the usage text to reflect these
peculiarities.

Change-Id: I9eafad207075f70b1321bb3559cb1363fe526f85
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update stack-preview usage text

`--timeout` during stack-preview is only used in certain validation
paths and `--enable-rollback` is not used at all except to be consistent
with stack-create.  This changes the usage text to reflect these
peculiarities.

Change-Id: I9eafad207075f70b1321bb3559cb1363fe526f85

commit_message:
labs: reattach shared dirs after export

Shared directories are removed when exporting VMs to an OVA file. This
patch reattaches the shared directories after the VMs haven been
exported.

Change-Id: I3527aac6958df906e2aac8d95744b2362e8660f9

commit_message:
labs: don't source labs-openstackrc.sh

Setup_neutron_network.sh attempts to source a file that has been
renamed. Because the script doesn't need authentication, we can
just remove the reference to the file.

Change-Id: Ie5c1c6bf8bda87b0e7cca9ec92aa86c53e866ff4

commit_message:
labs: exit after unhandled option

If the user supplies an unhandled option, the script should stop.
With this patch, it does.

Change-Id: If7b490cf8e4f11dcead16b8dee6e6fa6e4aa2f59

commit_message:
Updates Nova under training labs

Updates to nova, fixes some of the issues present in the scripts.

Changes the compute package from "nova-compute-kvm" to
"nova-compute-qemu".

Fixes Bug 1312764
Implements Blueprint: openstack-training-labs
Change-Id: Id3a2dc5f06921f803e07ef2dc8c4dbf64ea508be

commit_message:
VMware: handle case when VM snapshot delete fails

Minesweeper fails on occasion with concurrent access to files.

If a snapshot deletion fails with the backend exception
TaskInProgress then we will retry.

A generic decorator has been added to do the retry operations.

Closes-bug: #1310817

Change-Id: I8ed7a24ccd34aeea49352ac98f34ec2960edbf97

commit_message:
Fix haproxy backend checks dependencies

Openstack::Ha::Haproxy_service['keystone*']
should always be evaluated *before* any
Exec['wait-for-keystone*'] backend checks.

Closes-bug: 1352964

Change-Id: I579f33d673925bea27ceab48f3380ed1dda40170
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix tests dependency on config datastores and version

Reasons:
 - Int tests are dependent on config-based
   datastores and version, that are already stored in DB

Changes:
 - Fixing tests to use datastores and version from DB
   (through datastores API).

Change-Id: I0ea471df6358203e97b8ca65f920ce8d4b65201d
Closes-Bug: #1329347

We can obviously use passthrough for this, but I rather suspect that
OMFG something is broken get me debug will be a common phrase.

Change-Id: I62539630a4737bbbe6883ed71929f38c819ceed5
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make turning debug on globally easy.

We can obviously use passthrough for this, but I rather suspect that
OMFG something is broken get me debug will be a common phrase.

This is a version for if we revert the HOT migration.

Change-Id: I62539630a4737bbbe6883ed71929f38c819ceed5

subject: Implement full heat integration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8415, 'name': 'Denis M.', 'email': 'lildee1991@gmail.com', 'username': 'dmakogon'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-06 13:17:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor taskmanager. Split heat/native/migration code path

Reasons:
 - Trove should be able to manage resource provisioning through:
     - nova, cinder, designate etc. (navites);
     - heat. (orchestration).
     - Main reason is to provide harmless migration from the nova to heat,
       when heat would be cover all required use cases such as
       provisioning/resizing/network-attributes-management.

Changes:
 - Refactoring:
   - dividing actual manager onto navite(nova/cinder/designate/neutron)
     and orchestrator(heat);
   - extracting common code into taskmanager/common.py
   - fixing tests;
   - Resize instance for orchestrator added;
   - Resize volume for orchestrator added.
 - tox.ini modified to run all tests for natives or orchestration.

Change-Id: Ia9001877b1538e42bf81bec4e9947bf232547c06
Implements: blueprint resource-manager-interface

commit_message:
Implement full heat integration

Reasons:
 - Trove should be able to manage resource provisioning through:
     - nova, cinder, designate etc. (navites);
     - heat. (orchestration).
     - Main reason is to provide harmless migration from the nova to heat,
       when heat would be cover all required use cases such as
       provisioning/resizing/network-attributes-management.

Changes:
 - Refactoring:
   - dividing actual manager onto navite(nova/cinder/designate/neutron)
     and orchestrator(heat);
   - extracting common code into taskmanager/common.py
   - fixing tests;
   - Resize instance for orchestrator added;
   - Resize volume for orchestrator added.
 - tox.ini modified to run all tests for natives or orchestration.

Change-Id: Ia9001877b1538e42bf81bec4e9947bf232547c06
Implements: blueprint full-heat-integration

commit_message:
Add stack_id to base instance model

Reasons:
 - saving stack id would give to trove an
   ability to perform actions such as
   stack update/delete;

Changes:
 - adding stack_id column into base schema;
 - DBInstance model update.

Change-Id: Ie723a3c41e5ced19788a310cf727e1c143df6a62
Implements: blueprint stack-id

commit_message:
Change overcloud to use VIP for MySQL

This change sets applications to utilize the VIP address for database
connectivity and sets HAProxy in between the applications and MySQL.

This is a non-HOT version for unblocking CI deployments.

implements: blueprint tripleo-icehouse-ha-production-configuration
Change-Id: Ia9d6ed2771f756d2a97ae5df7ed737a062a59cf3

commit_message:
Fix rabbitmqctl status for rabbitmq container

Set RABBITMQ_NODENAME according to container hostname to make sure
"rabbitmqctl" command works properly.

Change-Id: Iedec5661da5029cd89ab2067bdcb582787275a90

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-19 20:10:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Permit specifying VLAN mappings to overclouds.

Sadly this will often need to be user controlled (to restrict the VLANs
to ones the network admins have allocated) - because while admin API
credentials are needed, its the mapping in the ovs plugin that actually
restricts what networks can operate - and defense in depth is a fairly
important security approach.

The default changes in the associated bridge mapping so that we can
fix a long standing configuration glitch where our ext-net is actually
defined as a gre overlay network!!!

Change-Id: I9687751753f810896c6d065750910da40132c9fa
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-19 21:07:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Permit specifying VLAN mappings to overclouds.

Sadly this will often need to be user controlled (to restrict the VLANs
to ones the network admins have allocated) - because while admin API
credentials are needed, its the mapping in the ovs plugin that actually
restricts what networks can operate - and defense in depth is a fairly
important security approach.

To use this we also need to change the defaults for bridge and flat
network mapping - and this happens to also permit fixing a long standing
configuration glitch where our ext-net is actually defined as a gre overlay
network!

Change-Id: I9687751753f810896c6d065750910da40132c9fa
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-07-19 22:11:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Permit specifying VLAN mappings to overclouds.

To use a VLAN based public network we need the ext-net network to be a
VLAN with a segmentation id - but we can't do this unless we also have
the datacentre datacentre physical network marked as allowing vlans.

We could make this strictly opt-in, but as this doesn't affect the
switch configuration (and thus actual machine capabilities) having it
on by default seems reasonable. OTOH we can't force it on, because
high security environments may well want a defense in depth setup
where neutron admins cannot configure VLANs that they are not meant
to have access too (consider that the cloud machine admins may be
separate to the folk running the services on top of them...)

Change-Id: I9687751753f810896c6d065750910da40132c9fa

commit_message:
Permit specifying VLAN mappings to overclouds.

To use a VLAN based public network we need the ext-net network to be a
VLAN with a segmentation id - but we can't do this unless we also have
the datacentre physical network marked as allowing vlans.

We could make this strictly opt-in, but as this doesn't affect the
switch configuration (and thus actual machine capabilities) having it
on by default seems reasonable. OTOH we can't force it on, because
high security environments may well want a defense in depth setup
where neutron admins cannot configure VLANs that they are not meant
to have access too (consider that the cloud machine admins may be
separate to the folk running the services on top of them...)

Change-Id: I9687751753f810896c6d065750910da40132c9fa

commit_message:
Add the iptables rule to allow gre traffic

Currently there's no rule to accept gre packets which are required for the
Neutron GRE networking case, so they are dropped due to the '999 drop all' rule

Change-Id: Ia79b6e8b26a8ccf7846affbd2dbf6aa758ac4947
Closes-bug: #1355794

commit_message:
Wait for keystone to become ready for floatingip creation

Wait for keystone service to become ready otherwise
haproxy reload can lead to haproxy returning
empty response and thus nova-floating-range provider
can not authorize with nova.

Change-Id: I8f9623411990679560b1694569dbb185883c4733
Closes-bug: 1351253
Closes-bug: 1348171

commit_message:
Refactor type_tunnel/gre/vxlan to reduce duplicate code

gre and vxlan type drivers have similar implementation for multiple
methods. This change abstracts these methods and move them to
TunnelTypeDriver.

sync_allocations method is not shared between gre and vxlan type drivers
because they use different strategies and the targeted one is unclear.

Change-Id: I717b70eb718f7ae82f1bc0c81543b0c438e8bddd

[{'created': '2014-08-15 10:30:55.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/docker/templates/functions.sh.erb', 'deployment/puppet/docker/templates/dockerctl.erb'], 'message': 'Add copy and revert commands to dockerctl

Revert: resets to latest image for container
Copy: copy files in and out of container
  Syntax:
    dockerctl copy src dest
    Only one of src or dest may be a container path
  New function examples:
    dockerctl copy /root/newpkg.rpm nailgun:/root/
    dockerctl copy nailgun:/etc/nailgun/settings.yaml /root/

Change-Id: Ia3cc999f6dc706b83d840a0e54c976c1bde2b6d4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add copy and revert commands to dockerctl

Revert: resets to latest image for container
Copy: copy files in and out of container
  Syntax:
    dockerctl copy src dest
    Only one of src or dest may be a container path
  New function examples:
    dockerctl copy /root/newpkg.rpm nailgun:/root/
    dockerctl copy nailgun:/etc/nailgun/settings.yaml /root/

Change-Id: Ia3cc999f6dc706b83d840a0e54c976c1bde2b6d4

commit_message:
Add list function to dockerctl

New dockerctl functions:
dockerctl list - outputs short name of each
available container
dockerctl list -l - outputs short name, image name,
status, and long container name of each container

Partial-Bug: #1324227

Change-Id: I30646db6d04bf8ff1f232c7e3021d790ec5d566a

commit_message:
Ensure web service starts before cobbler sync

An issue occurs on certain deployment types
(mainly virtual) that causes cobbler sync to
fail because httpd is not ready yet. Adding a
service check should cover this case.

Change-Id: I9e3a45089e25a7f8400a17faee0bfc1640580849
Closes-Bug: #1338552

commit_message:
Flake8: Fix F841

Enable F841 and fix all issues.

Flake F841 is:
F841 local variable 'XXX' is assigned to but never used

Also fix in changed files some occurences of:
E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent
H404  multi line docstring should start without a leading new line
H405  multi line docstring summary not separated with an empty line

Change-Id: Ifb08a82d05ac15c8e90f214a96e73d82ff850018
Partial-Bug: #1333290

commit_message:
Fix obtaining of service VM ip

service_instance module fails when VM in Nova is up, but get response from
Nova does not include network data. Expected field 'networks' is empty.
Fix is workaround for nova/neutron b_u_g #1210483

Change-Id: I4e066a07bb35ce85c2ac4513fbf027c9e84d5aa2
Closes-Bug: #1348632

commit_message:
Cmode, CIFS shares, fix allowed share access type

Cmode driver using CIFS helper checks rules for type and allows only old 'sid'
type that was changed to 'user' recently. After rebase to latest master it
became incompatible.

Change-Id: Ibce0ce84dc0a987839da1d546dc819c01baf7bc7
Closes-Bug: #1360548

commit_message:
Share common test settings in test_flavor_manage

In PrivateFlavorManageTest, there are duplicated test setting code in each
test. This patch moves these settings into setUp() method to reduce code.
In addition, this patch adds an internal method also for the same purpose.

Change-Id: I31883497174141ac4034922981e0a846f1fc2deb

method.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-01-06 16:43:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adds ability to configure max_io_ops_per_host from aggregates

Is now possible to use the filter AggregateIoOpsFilter and
define an aggregate with a metadata "max_io_ops" to
configure the max io operations for hosts in that aggreagate.

  + Creates new filter AggregateIoOpsFilter
  + Adds a base class for IoOpsFilter

Note:
  This upgrade was largely inspired from AggregateRamFilter
  and AggregateCoreFilter.

Change-Id: I086033e7904c16995298bee7196ad3e7b5dc7aaf

define an aggregate with a metadata "max_io_ops_per_host" to
configure the max io operations for hosts in that aggreagate.

  + Creates new filter AggregateIoOpsFilter
  + Adds a base class for IoOpsFilter
  + Updates devrefs for: IoOpsFilter and AggregateIoOpsFilter
  + Fix typo on the doc: s/differenet/different
  + Adds unit tests for AggregateIoOpsFilter

Note:
  This upgrade was largely inspired from AggregateRamFilter
  and AggregateCoreFilter.

commit_message:
filter: add per-aggregate filter to configure max_io_ops_per_host

Adds a filter AggregateIoOpsFilter whichprovides the ability
to read from aggregates metadata "max_io_ops_per_host".

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint per-aggregate-max-io-ops-per-host
Change-Id: I086033e7904c16995298bee7196ad3e7b5dc7aaf

commit_message:
Fix V2 unit tests to test hypervisor API as admin

Hypervisors API are Admin API and unit tests should test those accordingly.
But All the V2 hypervisors Unit tests tests those as a non Admin API

This patch fix this issue and add more non-admin unit tests

Change-Id: I5c29828d567e2044786d4bcbff4970219c6e8c5f
Closes-Bug: #1360113

commit_message:
VMware: refactor spawn() code to build a new VM

Move the spawn() code which builds a new VM into
vmops.build_virtual_machine().

We remove the duplicate check of instance_name. Other than that this
is straight code motion.

In addition, we add a basic test of the function of
build_virtual_machine, which tests that all given configuration is
reflected in the resulting virtual machine.

This change has been split out of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87002/, which was written by Shawn
Hartsock.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor

Co-authored-by: Shawn Hartsock <hartsocks@acm.org>
Change-Id: Id9c95966eefb644fdaf36465e7b3d3583826314a

commit_message:
VMware: Fix type of VM's config.hardware.device in fake

config.hardware.device was handled inconsistently, and could be of
various types. When created by _create_vm(), it was actually a
VirtualDeviceConfigSpec[]. It should be a VirtualDevice[].

Fix tests which depended on the wrong type.

Add _create_array_of_type function to fake to create an array type
which works correctly when passed to code. A returned array of Foo
must be an instance of class ArrayOfFoo, and contain a single
property, Foo, which is a python array of objects of type Foo.

Change-Id: Ic90e1d0d947941621606fded9e56f9a98d111cad

commit_message:
VMware: Create fake VM with given datastore

FakeVim._create_vm() was creating a VM with a default datastore rather
than the given one. This prevented testing that the correct datastore
has been used.

Change-Id: I640a21f23b2d5c1186772c8c5ce3ca8927e6cbc5

commit_message:
Add management interface for agent drivers

This commit adds management interface for the agent drivers
AgentAndIPMIToolDriver and AgentAndIPMINativeDriver, which is
required for setting boot device.

Change-Id: I90a9277357e490761567b76e13ca33da65ba476d
Closes-Bug: #1360224

commit_message:
Re-order stack.sh 2: target dir setup

Part 2 of a series

Re-order the setup and check bits in the top portion of stack.sh to
have a logical flow with similar things done together.

No behaviour changes are intended aside from the order of execution.
Any such changes are bugs.

* Consolidate DEST dir setup
* Move rpc & database init to just before project init

Change-Id: I2af1d4ed32ec34417c04592bf94fe645bb97f831

commit_message:
Reload iptables after purging rules, add rsyslog to post_start_hooks

In some cases, rsyslog would only unmasquerade UDP connections
and not TCP connections, causing issues with deployment.

This commit includes fixes for purging old iptables
rules that run into race conditions, as well as a fix
for grep to include '--' to handle strings that
start with dash.

Change-Id: I3913cb2ebd7fee42039e280f676b80f8f36e1841
Closes-Bug: #1360298

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-22 22:14:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add feature_request mechanism

This will be standart way for end users to ask Rally team to get
some new feature.

The idea is to make it realy simple for end users to ask about covering
their use cases.

E.g. to add request users don't need to deep dive in rally community,
road map and how it works. They need just to share their use cases
that is not covered by current rally functionality.

commit_message:
Add feature_request mechanism

This will be standart way for end users to ask Rally team to get
some new feature.

The idea is to make it realy simple for end users to ask about covering
their use cases.

E.g. to add request users don't need to deep dive in rally community,
road map and how it works. They need just to share their use cases
that is not covered by current rally functionality.

As a bonus adding some Readme.rst files related to doc/* dirs

Change-Id: I4c615101012ac9d1668ed766ac831f7e5c8129a8

Default policy is 'ignore' and it does nothing in order
to recover from partitioning allowing many partitioned
rabbit clusters to operate as is.
Auto-heal policy will merge all partitions into the winner
one once exited from partitioned state
(e.g. connectivity restored).

Closes-bug: #1354319

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make rabbitmq autoheal partitions

Default policy is 'ignore' and it does nothing in order
to recover from partitioning allowing many partitioned
rabbit clusters to operate as is.
Auto-heal policy will merge all partitions into the winner
one once exited from partitioned state
(e.g. connectivity restored).

Closes-bug: #1354319

Change-Id: I33823a3abfd42b75fa6bc73d6f3cd038a2163fd6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

Closes-bug: #1360264

commit_message:
Force chown for log files before starting rabbitmq

For some reason log files /var/log/rabbitmq/startup_log and
/var/log/rabbitmq/shutdown_log becomes owned be root,
preventing rabbitmq-server for murano (launched from 'rabbitmq' user)
from writing to them.

Change-Id: Ifa3d3484e3f22fe97cdb747c2c58f2d408246f32
Closes-bug: #1360264

commit_message:
Use murano-db-manage to run upgrades

In previous versions of Murano the command used to manage database
was 'murano-manage'. Now it is changed to 'murano-db-manage', however,
'murano-manage' still exists.

This patch fixes the name of the command, and renames variable used to
store path to 'murano-db-manage' to avoid confusion between the two
available commands.

Closes-bug: #1358738

Change-Id: Ib8a7a1f126a15c419dd8b6d27e5dd32bb5196b32

commit_message:
Update requirements, fix testsuite

Manually update from global requirements.
Remove obsolete docutils pin.
Regenerate climate config file.
Fix testsuite for testtools change.
Workaround PYTHONHASHSEED setting in tox, disable for now so that tests
always pass.

Change-Id: I8c4a458371b28c91c5b848094e56038a16d6afc3

commit_message:
Use oslo.db create_engine instead of SQLAlchemy

oslo.db may set additional options to engines that we may be interested in.

blueprint enable-mysql-connector

Closes-Bug: #1350942
Change-Id: I6f67bb430c50ddacb2d53398de75fb5f494964a0

commit_message:
Log exceptions inside spawned functions

eventlet pool will discards all exception raised inside spawn(_n), it is
hard to discover problems inside spawned green-threads, it is better to
add a function wrapper to log the exceptions raised inside spawned
function.

Change-Id: I753df36c4614759f49134667a55f2a91f0c08317
Closes-bug: #1340708

commit_message:
Removing sorted() function from assertEqual()

Removing unnecessary sorted() function from assertEqual() function
calls in functions used for sorting and pagination testing

Using sorted() breaks sorting tests objective which is to test sorting.
This is causing every unit test using this functions
(_test_list_with_sort, _test_list_with_pagination, _test_list_with_pagination_reverse)
for sorting tests to always succeed

Switched the parameters for assertEqual() function within the fixed code to meet
its signature - assertEqual(self, expected, observed, message='')

Test neutron.tests.unit.vmware.vshield.test_lbaas_plugin.TestLoadbalancerPlugin.test_list_vips
was succeeding because of this bug, although it should fail. It failed after the bug was fix.
Test was fixed.

Change-Id: Ia36b81d9a7fd32cae3b567ac1899b56481eb62ce
Closes-Bug: #1355251

[{'created': '2014-08-08 12:54:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not assume order of parameters in OVSBridge.add_flow call

This fixes neutron.tests.unit.agent.linux.test_ovs_lib.OVS_Lib_Test.test_add_flow

commit_message:
Do not assume order of parameters in OVSBridge.add_flow call

This fixes neutron.tests.unit.agent.linux.test_ovs_lib.OVS_Lib_Test.test_add_flow
unit test that breaks with a randomized PYTHONHASHSEED.

The test assumed that the parameters passed to add_flow had
elements in a particular order. Found with PYTHONHASHSEED=2455351445.
The fix refactors the test case to match parameters as set.

Partial-bug: #1348818

Note: There are several other unrelated unit tests that also break with a
randomized PYTHONHASHSEED, but they are not addressed here. They will be
addressed in separate patches.

Change-Id: Ibe2f4d929b8b42c8c909c2306d2554faf7109b49

commit_message:
List users doesn't support filtering by email

The Identity API v3 reference document said that a user could
filter the list users response by email, but this isn't supported.

Change-Id: I1d89e34ea6c54f46bd5b2424ee332f02d843433e
Closes-Bug: #1306835

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-25 16:36:59.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/engines/docker_engine.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/tests/test_docker_upgrader.py'], 'message': "Upgrades, fix astute keys migration

In some cases ssh keys copying fails
* user installs env and doesn't run
  deployment
* he runs upgrade
* it fails
* users runs it again
* it cannot copy keys and fails

The reason is, upgrade script had
a condition which reraised the
exception if directory existed.

As result we create empty directory
if there was an error.

Change-Id: Id30bc3bd8628cf6d6747c52a210f7abe9b94ca99
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Upgrades, fix astute keys migration

In some cases ssh keys copying fails
* user installs env and doesn't run
  deployment
* he runs upgrade
* it fails
* users runs it again
* it cannot copy keys and fails

The reason is, upgrade script had
a condition which reraised the
exception if directory existed.

As result we create empty directory
if there was an error.

Closes-bug: #1361284
Change-Id: Id30bc3bd8628cf6d6747c52a210f7abe9b94ca99

commit_message:
Fix HA mode troubles with Heat

HAProxy configuration doesn't include Heat services CFN and
Cloudwatch API (on port 8000 and 8003) as a result this services
unavailable via public interface.

Change-Id: I2b29a20be1cbd6f52e6d358b1e4075d3f7e73784
Closes-bug: #1353348

commit_message:
Updated usage for stack-preview rollback param

The --enable-rollback parameter was added to stack-preview command
for maintaining symmetry with the stack-create command in changeId
Ifda2b6bdf2380ce22c6f2027ea8ee4e6e977cf60.
Updated the usage text for stack-preview command to reflect that
the parameter does not affect the behavior of preview operation.

Change-Id: Ifcff7b7f3241d41e99491f1a6781569343e2dc56

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-31 05:32:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Unset HTTP_PROXY before running tests

urllib2 uses $http_proxy and requests uses $HTTP_PROXY.  If either of
these are set (and pointing to a remote host), then any tests that try
to spin up a local server and connect to it using
http://127.0.0.1:$port/ will try to connect to $port *on the proxy*, and
presumably fail.

We could hunt down and find all such tests and provide the appropriate
options to ignore HTTP_PROXY, but just fixing it globally here is easier
and more robust.

Note also that tox will still see $HTTP_PROXY and presumably use it for
pip fetches, etc when setting up the environment.  This change only
affects running the unittests.

Change-Id: I4d94fcc06925d0c947345a07ae20352e1898e46d
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-31 06:46:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Unset HTTP_PROXY before running tests

urllib2 uses $http_proxy and requests uses $HTTP_PROXY.  If either of
these are set (and pointing to a remote host), then any tests that try
to spin up a local server and connect to it using
http://127.0.0.1:$port/ will try to connect to $port *on the proxy*, and
presumably fail.

Unset $HTTPS_PROXY too for good measure.

Change-Id: I4d94fcc06925d0c947345a07ae20352e1898e46d
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-07-31 23:57:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Unset HTTP_PROXY before running tests

urllib2 and requests use $http_proxy/$HTTP_PROXY environment variables
by default.  If either of these are set (and pointing to a remote host),
then any tests that try to spin up a local server and connect to it
using http://127.0.0.1:$port/ will instead connect to $port *on the
proxy*, and presumably fail.

This change also clears $HTTPS_PROXY too for good measure.

Change-Id: I4d94fcc06925d0c947345a07ae20352e1898e46d
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2014-08-12 00:22:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Unset HTTP_PROXY before attempting to connect to test WSGI server

urllib2.urlopen uses $http_proxy/$HTTP_PROXY environment variables by
default.  If either of these are set (and pointing to a remote host),
then the WSGI tests that try to spin up a local server and connect to it
using http://127.0.0.1:$port/ instead connect to $port *on the proxy*,
and (hopefully) fail.

This change uses urllib2 in a way that ignores proxy settings.

Change-Id: I4d94fcc06925d0c947345a07ae20352e1898e46d
', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2014-08-12 00:24:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ignore http_proxy while connecting to test WSGI server

and (hopefully) fail.

This change uses urllib2 in a way that ignores proxy settings.

Change-Id: I4d94fcc06925d0c947345a07ae20352e1898e46d
', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2014-08-14 01:40:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Ignore http_proxy while connecting to test WSGI server

default.  If set (and pointing to a remote host), then the WSGI tests

commit_message:
Ignore http_proxy while connecting to test WSGI server

urllib2.urlopen uses $http_proxy/$HTTP_PROXY environment variables by
default.  If set (and pointing to a remote host), then the WSGI tests
that spin up a local server and connect to it using
http://127.0.0.1:$port/ instead connect to $port *on the proxy*,
and (hopefully) fail.

This change uses urllib2 in a way that ignores proxy settings.

Change-Id: I4d94fcc06925d0c947345a07ae20352e1898e46d
Closes-Bug: #1356665

commit_message:
javelin: add security groups support

Create and check that security groups survive at upgrades.

- Create security groups and rules
- Assign a security group after server creation
- Check security groups survive after upgrade

Change-Id: I7a8304782697d15f4201164695c321aa38097c17
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Update the autohelp readme

Switch to RST.

Only document the wrapper usage, since it handles all the environment
setup and is easier to use than the python scripts.

Add a requirements.txt file to ease the setup process and documentation.

Change-Id: Icc4f9cb4dfcaae6df8cd2567cc9b8f46fda0600c

commit_message:
Fix for floatingip-delete not removing fip_gw port

fip_agent_gateway_port is created dynamically on a
compute node where FIP namespace is created. When
floatingip-disassociate is called this 'port' is
deleted.

But when we call floatingip-delete this port is
not deleted.

This patch fixes the issue mentioned above.

Closes-Bug: #1351066

Change-Id: I1aa51680394547390546fe362abfae7a5d25425b

commit_message:
Enhance V3 version controller to provide JSON Home response

The V3 version controller would only respond with the normal version
JSON response. With this change, if the Accept header is
`application/json-home` it will respond with a JSON Home response
which includes all the registered JSON Home data. Note that there is
no JSON Home data yet so the response is empty.

bp json-home

Change-Id: Icfde89040b376bd6704d497966bd8ad109e32d08

commit_message:
Fix handling of missing external network

When an external network can't be found, project/routers/index.html will
result in a type error caused by calling exceptions.handle when no
exception is present.  In this case, an error message should be
displayed, and the missing-network should be indicated to the user.

Also added tests for this case.

Change-Id: I3aaa64de28738051ad84cc587fbb6cfd546f4662
Closes-Bug: 1220345

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-27 09:50:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Import registry's API to register the options

1ac30bbd667aa5266ddb2967198dceba787a6653 improved the way db_api options
are registered and as part of the change, the import of the registry api
in the test_registry suite was removed. Although the changes in that
commit work fine for Glance, they don't work that well for this test
suite since the `load_tests` function just registers the functions to
use for loading the database API without calling them. Unfortunately,
this causes the test registry to fail while trying to register the
registry client's options.

This patch adds the import back. A better solution will be added in a
follow-up patch. Such fix would require changing other db_api tests,
hence this patch is being proposed as a first fix.

Change-Id: I235d3f17242cb13e7c7480b835f67fc453a2dc54

commit_message:
Import registry's API to register the options

1ac30bbd667aa5266ddb2967198dceba787a6653 improved the way db_api options
are registered and as part of the change, the import of the registry api
in the test_registry suite was removed. Although the changes in that
commit work fine for Glance, they don't work that well for this test
suite since the `load_tests` function just registers the functions to
use for loading the database API without calling them. Unfortunately,
this causes the test registry to fail while trying to register the
registry client's options.

This patch adds the import back. A better solution will be added in a
follow-up patch. Such fix would require changing other db_api tests,
hence this patch is being proposed as a first fix.

Change-Id: I235d3f17242cb13e7c7480b835f67fc453a2dc54

subject: Make swiftclient a requirement
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-26 06:06:18.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Make swiftclient a requirement

Since there's a glance migration depending on swift and the swift store
is also widely used, this patch proposes making swiftclient a strong
dependency for glance.store.

I think it would be better to keep all store specific dependencies as
optional, we can remove swiftclient later again.

Change-Id: I88ccd70692524a2e57e2e6fda0ee52552dab4524
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make swiftclient a requirement

Since there's a glance migration depending on swift and the swift store
is also widely used, this patch proposes making swiftclient a strong
dependency for glance.store.

I think it would be better to keep all store specific dependencies as
optional, we can remove swiftclient later again.

Change-Id: I88ccd70692524a2e57e2e6fda0ee52552dab4524

commit_message:
Do not explicitly set mysql_engine

Setting the mysql_engine when creating a table is not needed
anymore as this is automatically done by an event listener
added with commit 466e89970f11918a809aafe8a048d138d4664299

Change-Id: I0df978dbf2bb44f17102da3c17fd4e93c9e4df8d
Closes-Bug: #1361176

commit_message:
Should we move Octavia meetings to IRC?  +1 yes, -1 webex

Pros:
- High bandwidth
- Faster
Cons:
- Much harder for non-native english speakers
- Much harder for the quieter types
- No logs

The current decision is webex, but it was made on webex, which is problematic.
Feel free to leave additional comments.

Change-Id: Ifef0547c6e01172c573a1d73fbabcb310de94a28

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-19 23:06:27.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/autoscaling.py', 'heat/tests/test_heat_autoscaling_group.py', 'heat/tests/generic_resource.py'], 'message': "Provide access to outputs from OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup

Allow get_attr on OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup to return a list of
corresponding attributes from each of the base resources. For example,

  {'get_attr': ['my_asg', 'outputs_list', 'networks', '<network_name>', 0]}

will return a list of the first IP address assigned to each server in the
group. This is modelled on similar functionality in the
OS::Heat::ResourceGroup resource. Similarly:

  {'get_attr': ['my_asg', 'outputs', 'networks', '<network_name>', 0]}

returns a mapping from resource names to the corresponding IP addresses.

Change-Id: Ib9e830e0c54602ac456d64179e1df30f0778906d
Closes-bug: #1356544
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Provide access to outputs from OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup

Allow get_attr on OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup to return a list of
corresponding attributes from each of the base resources. For example,

  {'get_attr': ['my_asg', 'outputs_list', 'networks', '<network_name>', 0]}

will return a list of the first IP address assigned to each server in the
group. This is modelled on similar functionality in the
OS::Heat::ResourceGroup resource. Similarly:

  {'get_attr': ['my_asg', 'outputs', 'networks', '<network_name>', 0]}

returns a mapping from resource names to the corresponding IP addresses.

Change-Id: Ib9e830e0c54602ac456d64179e1df30f0778906d
Closes-bug: #1356544

commit_message:
Improve Glance profiling

Put osprofiler middleware as a almost first middleware.
This allows us to:
1) Get more preciese duration. We are measuring duration of all middlewares.
2) authenticate middleware is requesting keystone, so if we init osprofiler
   before this middleware, we will get trace infomration from keystone as well.

Change-Id: I11c5d21e6e6b0bd514dee295da410b208d7c798c

commit_message:
Provide the V3 routers to the V3 extension controller

The V3 extension controller needs access to the V3 routers because
they provide the JSON Home data.

bp json-home

Change-Id: Ia455c7c5c06f7cfcefa0bc6afc91bf6954d85e3c

commit_message:
Raise proper exception in case duplicate ipv6 address is allocated

In case neutron tries to generate ipv6 address for slaac subnet,
it doesn't check that generated ip is unique and throws DB exception
that results in 500 HTTP error.

The fix throws proper IpAddressInUse exception.

Closes-Bug: #1358731
Change-Id: I66aed81b8d31d1eff6c87a77c4c4a813179ba458

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-09 22:23:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Re-order top of stack.sh

Re-order the setup and check bits in the top portion of stack.sh to
have a logical flow with similar things done together.  Also moves the logging
setup earler to make it available for debugging config variables.

No behaviour changes are intended aside from the order of execution.
Any such changes are bugs.

* Do sanity checks that have no configuration needs earlier
* Do supported distro check earlier
* Configure logging earlier
* Set exit traps earlier
* Set errexit earlier (required one outside fix so far)
* Set xtrace earlier to capture more of the OpenStack service configuration

Change-Id: I7d15bac199d6c4382d4a4d222784d34f2707da56

commit_message:
Re-order stack.sh 1: sanity checks

Part 1 of a series

Re-order the setup and check bits in the top portion of stack.sh to
have a logical flow with similar things done together.

No behaviour changes are intended aside from the order of execution.
Any such changes are bugs.

* Do sanity checks that have no configuration needs earlier
* Do supported distro check earlier

Change-Id: I7d15bac199d6c4382d4a4d222784d34f2707da56

commit_message:
Implement ip_lib.device_exists_with_ip_mac

ip_lib.device_exists simply checks that a device is in an
(optional) namespace. This patch adds
ip_lib.device_exists_with_ip_mac, which also verifies that
the device is configured with the given IP and MAC addresses.
The new function is used in functional tests in a patch
further down the dependency chain.

Added functional tests for ip_lib.device_exists,
ip_lib.device_exists_with_ip_mac.

Implements: blueprint l3-high-availability
Change-Id: I1495bcf1f1a88e2eb78df79cccb64121ccf435fb

commit_message:
Make SQL the default backend for Identity & Assignment unit tests.

We have a goal to deprecate the kvs backends for Identity and
Assignment. Before we can do this, we need to ensure our unit
tests are not dependant on them. This patch sets the Identity
backend for unit tests to SQL. Since, by default, the Assignment
backend will pick the same backend type as Identity, this also
means that it will follow suit.

As well as ensuring correct database initialization, this patch
moves a test that was erronously in v2_auth testing to v3. The
test was passing before due to the fact that the kvs assignment
driver does not correctly honor the domain boundary for all
project APIs.

Change-Id: I7b6e753b379a43d09ad8ea077ed6796d1f2e9a26
Partially-Closes: bug 1077282

commit_message:
Back off initial migration to 35

Upgrading from the Havana release to Juno is failing because the
initial Juno migration doesn't include a couple of migrations that
weren't in the initial Havana release but were added afterwards.

This change adds the 036 migration from Havana back in and moves
the initial Juno migration back to 035.

Change-Id: I1045696d66d7a63587aaaf70230a5eaf46e7d65d
Partial-Bug: #1357498

commit_message:
Allow to create a flavor without specifying id

On current v2 API, "create a flavor" API allows a request without
specifying "id" parameter. The API of v3 API, which is source of
v2.1, doesn't allow it now. However, it will cause a backwards
incompatible issue when implementing v2.1 API.
This patch makes v3 API allow it.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I2d3fda323df57f8c0c116347e3c4a38c807de31b

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-01 18:22:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Changes HTTP response code for unsupported HTTP methods

Requests for resources with an unsupported HTTP method now return a HTTP response 405 (Method Not Allowed) rather than a 404 (Not Found).
For example, attempting to DELETE on /v2/images will now return a 405 instead of a 404.

Change-Id: I5406f8ee423d3d5e66c56a26a7009b4f438a7e0f
Closes-Bug: #1297362
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-01 18:58:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Changes HTTP response code for unsupported methods

Requests for resources with an unsupported HTTP method now return a HTTP
response 405 (Method Not Allowed) rather than a 404 (Not Found). For
example, attempting to DELETE on /v2/images will now return a 405
instead of a 404.

Change-Id: I5406f8ee423d3d5e66c56a26a7009b4f438a7e0f
Closes-Bug: #1297362
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-07-08 00:49:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Changes HTTP response code for unsupported methods

Requests for resources with an unsupported HTTP method now return a HTTP
response 405 (Method Not Allowed) or 501 (Not Implemented) rather than a
404 (Not Found) for everything.

For example, attempting to DELETE on /v2/images will now return a 405
instead of a 404 and will provide a response header 'Allow' that lists
the valid methods for the resource.

Attempting to use NON_EXISTANT_METHOD on /v2/images will now return a
501.

Attempting to GET on /v2/non_existant_resource will, as expected, return
a 404.

Change-Id: I5406f8ee423d3d5e66c56a26a7009b4f438a7e0f
Closes-Bug: #1297362

501.

Attempting to GET on /v2/non_existant_resource will, as expected, return
a 404.

Fixed for v1 and v2.

Change-Id: I5406f8ee423d3d5e66c56a26a7009b4f438a7e0f
Closes-Bug: #1297362

commit_message:
Changes HTTP response code for unsupported methods

Requests for resources with an unsupported HTTP method now return a HTTP
response 405 (Method Not Allowed) or 501 (Not Implemented) rather than a
404 (Not Found) for everything.

For example, attempting to DELETE on /v2/images will now return a 405
instead of a 404 and will provide a response header 'Allow' that lists
the valid methods for the resource.

Attempting to use NON_EXISTENT_METHOD on /v2/images will now return a
501.

Attempting to GET on /v2/non_existent_resource will, as expected, return
a 404.

Fixed for v1 and v2.

Change-Id: I5406f8ee423d3d5e66c56a26a7009b4f438a7e0f
Closes-Bug: #1297362

commit_message:
Bump zake up to 0.1

It was about time to release zake 0.1 so this was done after
we added multiple fake client/s -> one fake storage support
and verified that the basics work so we should be good to
use this in projects that want to...

commit_message:
handle invalid seamicro_api_version

If the value for seamicro_api_version is invalid, seamicro raises
an exception. Instead of the seamicro exception, this patch raises
an InvalidParameterValue exception instead.

Change-Id: I2526304e8aedbf2c2822296e3963462ce980d466
Partial-Bug: #1267693

commit_message:
Take iSCSI deploy out of pxe driver

This commit aims at separating the iSCSI deploy portions
from pxe driver so that it can reused in the newly proposed
iLO virtualmedia driver.

Implements: blueprint ironic-ilo-virtualmedia-driver
Change-Id: Id0a4b0fab797c884448a27b1cd5e3a1da05786a7

commit_message:
neutronv2: treat instance as object in deallocate_for_instance

The deallocate_for_instance method is given an instance object
but the neutronv2 API was treating it like a dict. This changes
the method to use dot notatoin for accessing fields on the
object and updates the unit tests to pass an instance object
rather than a dict.

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I784d1d59c23da8485d355251aba26b98bd9c7a16

commit_message:
Remove _instance_update usage in _default_block_device_names

We have an instance object in _default_block_device_names so
we can just call instance.save() directly.  We don't need to
update resource tracker stats so there is no need to call
_instance_update in this method.

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: Ia8faa67a36ff31a3ba526770f5d8a0361326ffc7

commit_message:
Remove duplicated code in test_user_data

In test_user_data, there is duplicated code for creating a request.
In addition, there is an internal method which works as almost same
as the duplicated code.
This patch makes the tests use the internal method and removes the
duplicated code for cleanup.

Change-Id: Ie87cc14a3ac67bc1262de155dc0a1dcf5c5e7d9a

commit_message:
More informative nova-scheduler log after NoValidHost is caught.

This patch adds a warning log entry for when a NoValidHost
exception causes a scheduling error. The NoValidHost
exception's message will be logged before reporting that
the machine went to error. Previously, all other exceptions
would show a stack trace. However, since the NoValidHost case
is skipped, a user may not understand why his/her machine
went to an ERROR state. This patch seeks to remove any
confusion.

Change-Id: I0f01b1095251f5c659fe010c7376f3f6bc56babe
Closes-Bug: 1336977

[{'created': '2014-08-25 14:39:52.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'tests/files/gr-base.txt'], 'message': "Bump minimum required version for simplejson to 2.2.0

oslo-incubator commit ad248f6 adds usage of the namedtuple_as_object
kwarg to simplejson's json.dumps.

oslo-incubator's test-requirements requires simplejson >= 2.0.9 but
namedtuple_as_object wasn't available until 2.2.0.

This is important for anyone doing keystone database migrations on RHEL
6.5 with simplejson since the migrations will fail if you don't have a
new enough simplejson (keystone is using this code now).

Change-Id: I59f4e9c42ad83a305d810e52e440ff51ff5b7f0e
Closes-Bug: #1361230
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Bump minimum required version for simplejson to 2.2.0

oslo-incubator commit ad248f6 adds usage of the namedtuple_as_object
kwarg to simplejson's json.dumps.

oslo-incubator's test-requirements requires simplejson >= 2.0.9 but
namedtuple_as_object wasn't available until 2.2.0.

This is important for anyone doing keystone database migrations on RHEL
6.5 with simplejson since the migrations will fail if you don't have a
new enough simplejson (keystone is using this code now).

Change-Id: I59f4e9c42ad83a305d810e52e440ff51ff5b7f0e
Closes-Bug: #1361230

commit_message:
Treat instance like an object in _default_block_device_names

The _default_block_device_names method already gets an instance object
but was treating it like a primitive dict so this change enforces the
object usage with dot notation when accessing fields.

Also updates the existing unit tests to use an instance object.

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I2706fa081ba427956dc4f643d1e5664eaa2573ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-15 15:16:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "objects: Add base test for obj_make_compatible()

A previous commit fixed a bug in obj_make_compatible() of the
InstanceGroup object.  While fixing that, I added a test targeted at
that object.  This patch adds a test that calls obj_make_compatible()
on every past version of every object.  It doesn't actually test that
the data is converted, but it makes sure that calling the method
doesn't blow up on something basic like expecting the wrong format of
the version parameter.

Only one object had to change for this test to work, and that was a
test object.  It assumed a field was always set, and it's not in the
case of this test.  However, the field in question is not actually set
as nullable, so it *should* be set.  However, the way these methods
are implemented elsewhere, they never assume the field to be set and
present in the primitive version of the object.

Change-Id: Id56b2f9763cfcb99a3c4a2d56329485c5e9c3b5c
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-15 15:21:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "objects: Add base test for obj_make_compatible()

the data is converted, but it makes sure that calling the method
doesn't blow up on something basic like expecting the wrong format of

Only one object had to change for this test to work, and that was a

case of this test.  The field in question is not actually set
as nullable, so it *should* be set.  However, the way these methods

commit_message:
objects: Add base test for obj_make_compatible()

A previous commit fixed a bug in obj_make_compatible() of the
InstanceGroup object.  While fixing that, I added a test targeted at
that object.  This patch adds a test that calls obj_make_compatible()
on every past version of every object.  It doesn't actually test that
the data is converted, but it makes sure that calling the method
doesn't blow up on something basic like expecting the wrong format of
the version parameter.

Only one object had to change for this test to work, and that was a
test object.  It assumed a field was always set, and it's not in the
case of this test.  However, the field in question is not actually set
as nullable, so it *should* be set.  However, the way these methods
are implemented elsewhere, they never assume the field to be set and
present in the primitive version of the object.

Change-Id: Id56b2f9763cfcb99a3c4a2d56329485c5e9c3b5c

commit_message:
Mock processutils.execute properly in test_ibmnas

test_delete_snapfiles and test_delete_snapfiles_nas_gpfs were
not properly mocking out cinder.openstack.common.processutils.execute .
This was causing the unittests to prompt for a sudo password during
unit test on some systems.

This change mocks out processutils.execute to return what is expected
for this test case.

Change-Id: I67f26cfd3157813758de7785157a21ebe5230833
Closes-bug: 1361287

commit_message:
Treat instance like an object in _build_instance

The _build_instance method has an instance object already
but treats it like a primitive dict.  This change uses
dot notation to access fields on the object and updates
the unit tests to use instance objects.

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I19c5abc502b57579b4706e8a8e7b7a64f6f9b6ca

commit_message:
Filter images when booting from volume

Only show raw disk format images when *Instance Boot Source* is
*Boot from image (creates a new volume)*.

Change-Id: Ib5ef915599697a54b57d362799f27e75b208f68d
Closes-bug: 1310438

commit_message:
Use ram_allocation_ratio when doing live migration

ram_allocation_ratio is used when booting a new instance, but is not used
when migrating an instance. This may caused a problem that booting a new
instance to a host is fine but not migrating an instance to it when there
is overcommit configed for memory. This patch fixes the problem by multiplying
avaliable memory by ram_allocation_ratio when doing migration pre-check with
FilterScheduler.

Change-Id: If6ec88641970777236f857139a408a4b53eceba4
Closes-bug: 1323538

commit_message:
Encapsulate top-level lists in responses in object

All top-level JSON arrays in response bodies are now encapsulated within
an object. Endpoints changed:
messages_get_many: GET /v1.1/queues/{queue}/messages?ids=
claim_create: POST /v1.1/queues/{queue}/claims

Partially-implements: blueprint api-v1.1-response-document-changes
Change-Id: I81e64decc928be665b8b4f4d0e238fd701794bc9

commit_message:
Remove _instance_update usage in _build_instance

The _build_instance method has an instance object so
just call instance.save() rather than _instance_update
which does a separate call to conductor to update the
instance updates the resource tracker, which is
unnecessary in this case. Compare to the _build_resources
method.

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: Ic350a424f83638e8129d55dda168913798ebc31a

- Model synchronization
- Router external gateway

Implements blueprint: apic-driver-enhancements

commit_message:
Adding alarm history to telemetry

Alarm history appears as a subresource of alarms.
Alarm history supports list only, with optional query filtering.

Change-Id: Iaad5b6c1451c48a450b86e280860903b4324d2f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-05 15:42:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add driver name on driver load exception

When non-DriverLoadError exception occurs during driver loading, it is
reraised, providing no information about driver that caused it. In
this patch such exceptions are wrapped in DriverLoadError with driver

commit_message:
Add driver name on driver load exception

When non-DriverLoadError exception occurs during driver loading, it is
reraised, providing no information about driver that caused it. In this
patch such exceptions are wrapped in DriverLoadError with driver name
provided and reraised if driver is enabled.

Closes-bug: #1352443
Change-Id: I203618f1c88b940b0122dd1dc204df6325e5e54c

commit_message:
Make Object FieldType from_primitive pass objects

In case we have a ListOfObjects field on an object with a remotable
method, due to NovaObjectsSerializer now looking into dicts recursively,
and thus also into the updates dict that object_action returns,
it is possible that objects inside a list have already been
deserialized, so we make the Fields from_primitive just pass them on,
since the job was already done by the NovaObjectsSerializer.

Change-Id: Ib2a34a115cb2d0a2a0765c81d5dd7ef331077eb5
Closes-bug: #1360656

subject: Set PYTHONHASHSEED for venv tox environment
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3099, 'name': 'David Shrewsbury', 'email': 'dshrewsb@redhat.com', 'username': 'dshrews'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-25 19:51:25.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Set PYTHONHASHSEED for venv tox environment

We're seeing frequent failures of the docs Jenkins job that appear
to be caused by the tox 1.7.2 upgrade and the migration to using
PYTHONHASHSEED=random.  This overrides the environment in the venv
testenv to set PYTHONHASHSEED=0 and allows docs to build
successfully.  Note that we want to run our tests with a random seed
if possible, so this avoids disabling it for the base testenv and
only uses non-random for the testenv used by Jenkins for doc builds.

Change-Id: I665703c9a002500bc90b90cd268bd3ccff4e3534
Closes-bug: 1361295
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set PYTHONHASHSEED for venv tox environment

We're seeing frequent failures of the docs Jenkins job that appear
to be caused by the tox 1.7.2 upgrade and the migration to using
PYTHONHASHSEED=random.  This overrides the environment in the venv
testenv to set PYTHONHASHSEED=0 and allows docs to build
successfully.  Note that we want to run our tests with a random seed
if possible, so this avoids disabling it for the base testenv and
only uses non-random for the testenv used by Jenkins for doc builds.

Change-Id: I665703c9a002500bc90b90cd268bd3ccff4e3534
Closes-bug: 1361295

commit_message:
Configurable python-keystoneclient repo

The URL for the python-keystoneclient repo couldn't be configured.
With this change, the user can set the OPENSTACK_REPO environment
variable to set the URL for where the python-keystoneclient repo
should be cloned from. So for example you can use a local clone.
The default OPENSTACK_REPO is https://git.openstack.org/openstack
which gets python-keystoneclient.git added ot it to make the clone
come from
https://git.openstack.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient.git.

Change-Id: I936713af3c11e8d68d8739dc68eefabd645df294

commit_message:
Move fake session to HTTPClient

The fake session object is to prevent a cyclical dependency between
HTTPClient and the session from leaving hanging session objects around.

This is still necessary if you construct a client the old way however if
you are using the session properly then there is no cyclical dependency
and so we shouldn't prevent people using the connection pooling
advantages of the session.

Related-Bug: #1282089
Change-Id: Ifca2c7ddd95a81af01ee43246ecc8e74abf95602

commit_message:
Set ssh_virt_type to vmware

Tests for set_boot_device and get_boot_device were incorrectly setting
the ssh_virt_type to vmware, so that it didn't get changed from the
original vbox value. This fixes it.

Change-Id: I66087ddd258852b6c36f5972deae8bde24c69572
Closes-Bug: #1360015

commit_message:
Add a test for re-caching a token

There was no test that showed that when a token was in the cache
and a request is made to validate it again, it gets cached again.

commit_message:
Gate-supporting files for functional tests

To support running functional tests from the gate:
- directory functionaltests for hook scripts (and maybe test packages)
- tox.ini functional environment placeholde
- devstack post_test_hook, pre_test_hook scripts which are run
  by the gate job

Change-Id: Iead98b60149807e26a4888c3497876483ca803b7
Partial-Blueprint: functional-tests

commit_message:
command not found errors on unstack

- add lib/ceilometer and lib/heat to source list for when stop_heat
and stop_ceilometer functions are called.
- add lib/tls source to lib/keystone for when is_ssl_enabled_service
function called.

Change-Id: Ief05766e9cfda71fb6392c8a757d04751283414e
Closes-Bug: #1269047
(cherry picked from commit 5eec5b6b80401842ad1f7275d9c7a6949cc6f848)

Change-Id: Ieef882944bafd98f7b27497a5276124b21c3e576
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-08-22 21:18:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Change httpd Keystone log level to default

Having Keystone's log level at debug caused a lot of uninteresting
Httpd-related log lines to be displayed which makes debugging more
difficult than it should be.

Rather than set the log level explicitly, Keystone will use the

Having Keystone's log level at debug caused a lot of uninteresting
Httpd-related log lines to be displayed which makes debugging more
difficult than it should be.

commit_message:
Change httpd Keystone log level to default

Having Keystone's log level at debug caused a lot of uninteresting
Httpd-related log lines to be displayed which makes debugging more
difficult than it should be.

Rather than set the log level explicitly, Keystone will use the
Httpd server's setting, which defaults to warn.

Partial-Bug: #1359995
Change-Id: Ieef882944bafd98f7b27497a5276124b21c3e576

commit_message:
Add cases for Swift scenario test

Based on current implement, we have already implemented the
basic ops of swift. However, as a object storage service,
object download and verification are key function of it. So
this patch is aim to enhance that to get a complete end to end
function flow.

Change-Id: Id0bdcd2105ad90ea1500c7cbd1acdbe19e5aa361

commit_message:
Refresh rpc_backend values in unit tests to those from oslo.messaging

Though old values are supported via compatibility transport aliases [1],
it's better to stick to those values that are officially supported by
oslo.messaging.

[1]: neutron/common/rpc.py:TRANSPORT_ALIASES

blueprint oslo-messaging

Change-Id: I7bc03e323151cfdda2cb2bc4cd6f5aea9b87a746

commit_message:
Do not try to reboot a stopped instance

reboot should not be a valid action on a stopped
instance since it causes problems with iptable
rules associated with the instance

This patch removes STOPPED and SUSPENDED from the
list of valid states from which the VM can reboot

Related-Bug: #1316822
DocImpact

Change-Id: Iaac4006fe07e5ff6d7d6d415f42c953ddf1fdb2d

The migration hostname is substituted into the libvirt migration
URI string. If the hostname contains special characters it might
be possible to construct a malicious migration URI causing libvirt

Closes-bug: #1276872"
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
"libvirt: add validation of migration hostname

The migration hostname is substituted into the libvirt migration
URI string. If the hostname contains special characters it might
be possible to construct a malicious migration URI causing libvirt
to execute arbitrary commands as root. Protect against such a risk
by validating the hostname characters.

Change-Id: Ibb0e7d6eed735353a9db84d78859566bd79c32b4
Closes-bug: #1276872"

commit_message:
Add pdb support to tox with debug helper shell script

The Keystone team has been using a home brewed `debug_helper.sh`
file to run tests with pdb support, it's now being also used by
pycadf too. As noted by bnemec [1] we should move this to oslo.
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/pycadf/+bug/1354192

To run any test in particular, run tox with -e debug:
  `tox -e debug`

It also supports passing in a specific test module, class or case.
The shell file runs testtools underneath the covers to get pdb
support.

Change-Id: Idb715bc137459a2f6d16ac3f65c718a567df49ff
Co-Authored-By: Brant Knudson <bknudson@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Minor refactoring of auto_schedule_routers

The method is more complicated than it needs to be, and it makes it difficult
to target fixes for it.

This is done in preparation of fix for DB lock timeout errors observed while
dealing with DVR routers.

Test coverage is already provided, and more granular coverage is added to
reflect the new structure being introduced.

Partial-bug: #1356121

Change-Id: Ifb7a742b64139f3a5d9b88c3c6261b1b890946f9

commit_message:
Assign Cisco nw profile to multi-tenants in single request

Currently with Cisco N1kv plugin, user can assign cisco network
profile to only one tenant in a request. So user has to send
multiple requests to assign a cisco network profile to multiple
tenants.
This fix is going to add the support to assign to multiple tenants
in a single request

This fix has corresponding changes in neutron, python-neutronclient
and horizon. All the changes should be committed at the same time

Change-Id: I42ffbd17a80f741d9cf1094dc79b588444bd9d4b
Implements: blueprint cisco-network-profile-multi-tenants-support

commit_message:
Move usage_timeout out of guest options

In an effort to further separate the guest and task manager,
the usage_timeout has been moved into the common cfg. The
datastores have no need for this. the default is now set as
the largest timeout, cassandra.

DocImpact: This change modifies a configuration parameter.
partially implements: blueprint refactoring-datastore-options-in-cfg
Co-Author: Michael Basnight <mbasnight@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I3b4b2a9bffb40df4531a78c29d1e155e59436948

[{'created': '2014-08-21 21:06:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Do not log WARN messages about lack of L3 agents for DVR routers

DVR routers are scheduled only when there is need to: for instance when
there's an external gateway associated with it, or when there are
interfaces attached to subnets on which VM's are actually being deployed.

Therefore, do not log misleading messages that apply only to the
centralized case.

Closes-bug: 1358998

Change-Id: Ica7f0d25fe576f05a9adf8eb8239704f09c0b0ac

DVR routers are scheduled only when there is need to: for instance when
there's an external gateway associated with it, or when there are
interfaces attached to subnets on which VM's are actually being deployed.

Change-Id: Ica7f0d25fe576f05a9adf8eb8239704f09c0b0ac
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Do not log WARN messages about lack of L3 agents for DVR routers

DVR routers are scheduled only when there is need to: for instance when
there's an external gateway associated with it, or when there are
interfaces attached to subnets on which VM's are actually being deployed.

Therefore, do not log misleading messages that apply only to the
centralized case.

Closes-bug: 1358998

Change-Id: Ica7f0d25fe576f05a9adf8eb8239704f09c0b0ac

commit_message:
Fix policy rules for adding and removing router interfaces

Currently "add_router_interface" and "remove_router_interface"
policy rules have the "update_router" prefix and thus are never
enforced. Removing the prefix activates the rules.

Also moved some rules, so that all router-related rules are
now grouped together.

Closes-Bug: 1356678
Change-Id: Ib6cc45f2c6d0c7ae394274d6196262529b9fd855

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-11 21:38:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Centralize neutron config file argument generation

Moves dynamic generation of the --config-file list from local functions
to global utility functions.  This breaks up the current non-obvious
dependency between start_neutron_agents and _configure_neutron_l3_agent
for setting the correct arguments for the vpn agent.   This also similarly
updates generation of arguments for neutron-server and neutron-l3-agent to
use said functions.  Finally, this cleans lib/neutron up a bit and moves
all default paths to config files and binaries out of local functions and
into the top-level, allowing external tools like Grenade to make use of the
library for starting Neutron services and agents currently.

Change-Id: I927dafca8a2047d6c0fd3c74569ed2521f124547
Closes-bug: #1355429.

commit_message:
Centralize neutron config file argument generation

Moves dynamic generation of the --config-file list from local functions
to global utility functions.  This breaks up the current non-obvious
dependency between start_neutron_agents and _configure_neutron_l3_agent
for setting the correct arguments for the vpn agent.   This also similarly
updates generation of arguments for neutron-server and neutron-l3-agent to
use said functions.  Finally, this cleans lib/neutron up a bit and moves
all default paths to config files and binaries out of local functions and
into the top-level, allowing external tools like Grenade to make use of the
library for starting Neutron services and agents currently.

Change-Id: I927dafca8a2047d6c0fd3c74569ed2521f124547
Closes-bug: #1355429

commit_message:
Change location of OS-ENDPOINT-POLICY name in API urls.

The current APIs simply put OS-ENDPOINT-POLICY at the start of the
API url. Technically, this should appear in the url at the
location where this differs from the standard core urls.

Partially implements: bp endpoint-policy

Change-Id: I2c49d46e2374aed2411849bd2fd1adf42beaa2c6

commit_message:
EMC Manila driver

EMC specific NAS storage driver. This driver is a pluggable driver
that allows specific EMC NAS devices to be plugged-in as the underlying
backend. Use the Manila configuration variable "share_backend_name"
to specify, which backend plugins to use.

VNX and Isilon plugins will be submitted later in different patches.

partially implements: blueprint emc-driver

Change-Id: Ibe174d22a5a63693fa28998459434f9db25fb878

subject: Improve performance of get_meters
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5619, 'name': 'Koert van der Veer', 'email': 'koert@cloudvps.com', 'username': 'kvdveer'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-16 14:46:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Improve performance of get_meters

get_meters used an unfiltered subquery to find the latest IDs.
This is a performance problem as that means that it will find the
last IDs for _all_ meters, not just the ones queried for. This
patch adds _apply_filters to the subquery to limit its scope

Closes-Bug: #1320257

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-05-16 15:13:17.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'Improve performance of get_meters

commit_message:
Improve performance of get_meters

get_meters used an unfiltered subquery to find the latest IDs.
This is a performance problem as that means that it will find the
last IDs for _all_ meters, not just the ones queried for. This
patch adds _apply_filters to the subquery to limit its scope

Closes-Bug: #1320257

Change-Id: Idf0dc573a2e2340f2fdfe001dfc2adee42b4b8db

commit_message:
Update horizon local settings conf files for Juno

* Update local_settings
  - Add in description comments
  - Add new sections
* Update specs as needed
* Change metadata for apache2 to < 2.0.0 since it's not
backward compatible with 1.9.x.

Change-Id: I455624f809ad5968a9fbef3054c1bd10bcac5378
Closes-Bug: #1352956

commit_message:
Change default MySQL module api to 2.x

2.2 came out on 2014-02-13, so it seems reasonable to default to this
for the Juno release.  Note that the fixtures are updated to test
against the 2.3.x branch.

Closes-Bug: 1338670
Change-Id: Ie8606fd719c715505a59d96004961a829c0a4f5a

commit_message:
Fix incorrect accounting of total requests in benchmark consumer

This patch fixes a bug where total requests were not taking into
account that a single claim may return more than one message.

Change-Id: I43973d314c56a319f8ecbd6de69332dd27f1dfdb

[{'created': '2014-07-19 22:11:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixup network configuration for ext-net

We currently make the external network a single-node gre network but
this is not at all correct for HA environments - we need a provider
network, which means having a bridge mapping, a flat network
specified, and then because we run the same ovs config everywhere we
need br-ex on the hypervisors too. This is entirely reasonable since
DVR will require this as well (and solve lots of scaling issues...).

commit_message:
Fixup network configuration for ext-net

We currently make the external network a single-node gre network but
this is not at all correct for HA environments - we need a provider
network, which means having a bridge mapping, a flat network
specified, and then because we run the same ovs config everywhere we
need br-ex on the hypervisors too. This is entirely reasonable since
DVR will require this as well (and solve lots of scaling issues...).

Change-Id: I8b63ab51e7e20b235430fad8d786d8da005d84a1

commit_message:
Add order plugin metadata entity and logic

To support certificate plugin workflows, plugins needs a means to persist
their state in between method invocations by Barbican core. This CR adds
that persistence feature, by adding a new SQLAlchemy model and migration file,
and a new repository.

Change-Id: Ic0f74d49ab8c97e5b15c61fbc8c64d00bd9c8b5e
Implements: blueprint add-ssl-ca-support

commit_message:
Make claim batch size configurable in benchmark tool

This patch adds a new config option so that the user can control the
number of messages the consumer claims at a time. The default is
5 rather than 1, since claims are designed for batch processing
of tasks.

Change-Id: I18d58d09526cf0f7121a1b3ef532a4f15ff206e7

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 6648, 'name': 'Changbin Liu', 'email': 'changbin.liu@gmail.com', 'username': 'changbl'}, {'_account_id': 8136, 'name': 'Viswa Vutharkar', 'email': 'vpvutharkar@ebaysf.com', 'username': 'vvutharkar'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9608, 'name': 'Pranesh Pandurangan', 'email': 'praneshpg@gmail.com', 'username': 'pran1990'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-09 23:59:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make greenexecutor not keep greenthreads active

Instead of keeping all greenthreads active even
if they are not being used only keep the greenthreads
active if there exists active work to complete.

This saves resources (each greenthread takes up
memory) and allows a pool to shrink and grow in
a more dynamic fashion.

Fixes bug 1339406

Change-Id: Idc8ab8447045915a0ffbaf21fa5c4bdb7a9e3593

commit_message:
Make greenexecutor not keep greenthreads active

Instead of keeping all greenthreads active even
if they are not being used only keep the greenthreads
active if there exists active work to complete.

This saves resources (each greenthread takes up
memory) and allows a pool to shrink and grow in
a more dynamic fashion.

Fixes bug 1339406

Change-Id: Idc8ab8447045915a0ffbaf21fa5c4bdb7a9e3593

commit_message:
Allow backup-to-swift to take swift URL from service catalogue

Since the swift URL is usually in the service catalogue, there is
no need to configure it explicitly.

It can still be set explicitly where manual override is desired.

Change-Id: Ia6c08289b532faed3f6e718d4bbcc1f91978db21

commit_message:
Correct row count for tables in tab

Tables that are hidden by the tab will not exhibit a height or width,
and therefore, will not get accounted for correctly. The solution is to
remove the visible selector (not needed to begin with).

According to the jquery doc, only elements that have a height or width
are considered visible. Follow link for more information:
http://api.jquery.com/visible-selector/

Change-Id: I5536366f0183c636e001e83cf3862a7a230d38a1
Closes-Bug: #1350949

commit_message:
Check on schemes not stores

Since the `_upload` method loads the store based on the scheme, we need
to check whether the scheme exists in the known schemes instead of
checking in the list of known stores. Without this fix, stores with a
scheme name different than the store itself will not be usable through
the `x-image-meta-store` header.

Conflicts:
	glance/api/v1/images.py

Closes-bug: #1357462
(cherry picked from commit 4502759243c0f363545f4236b41abaf8bcf9a37b)
Change-Id: Ia33afc1629cb47a31982df7932ac0d9aeb201b4f

This test tries to log in as the new user that it created:
        creds = KeystoneV3Credentials(username=user_name,
                                      password=user_name,
                                      domain_name=dom_name,
                                      user_domain_name=dom_name,
                                      tenant_name=proj_name)
        auth_provider = KeystoneV3AuthProvider(creds)
        creds = auth_provider.fill_credentials()

The client is created, however anything you try to do with this user's

commit_message:
using credentials of users created on-the-fly

This test tries to log in as the new user that it created:
        creds = KeystoneV3Credentials(username=user_name,
                                      password=user_name,
                                      domain_name=dom_name,
                                      user_domain_name=dom_name,
                                      tenant_name=proj_name)
        auth_provider = KeystoneV3AuthProvider(creds)
        creds = auth_provider.fill_credentials()
        admin_client = clients.Manager(interface=self._interface, credentials=creds)

The client is created, however anything you try to do with this user's
credentials results in an 'Unauthorized' response...

This is still WIP

Change-Id: Ic1c85ef747ad969636acc0972e630b8c3b26b738

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-23 22:00:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add debug helper file and tox environment

The Keystone team has been using a home brewed `debug_helper.sh`
file to run tests with pdb support, it's now being also used by
pycadf too. As noted by bnemec we should move this to oslo.

To run any test in particular, run tox with -e debug:
  `tox -e debug`
It also supports passing in a specific test module, class or case.

The shell file runs testtools underneath the covers to get pdb
support.

The hope is that other projects will adopt this when they sync
oslo, and get support, similar to the shell files used to create
virtual environments.

Co-Authored-By: Brant Knudson <bknudson@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I5fce559d0e4522da06b3aabd9b39aa4518b1e0e7

commit_message:
Add pdb support to tox with debug helper shell script

The Keystone team has been using a home brewed `debug_helper.sh`
file to run tests with pdb support, it's now being also used by
pycadf too. As noted by bnemec [1] we should move this to oslo.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/pycadf/+bug/1354192

To run any test in particular, run tox with -e debug:
  `tox -e debug`
It also supports passing in a specific test module, class or case.

The shell file runs testtools underneath the covers to get pdb
support.

The hope is that other projects will adopt this when they sync
oslo, and get support similar to the shell files used to create
virtual environments.

Co-Authored-By: Brant Knudson <bknudson@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I5fce559d0e4522da06b3aabd9b39aa4518b1e0e7
