commit_message:
Remove common.transport.wsgi.utils

This module is just being used by v1_[01]/pools.py and contains 2
functions that are common *just* for the wsgi transport. Since we
already have a wsgi.utils modules, it's not worth to keep this one in
common.

Change-Id: I8374e2bf62e1b87f7e60a3dd68bec196bc57948d

commit_message:
Adding a hits to notice operator when trace not found

A wrong HMAC key provided in original calling will make osprofiler
refuses to collect tracing data. This change updated hits output of
command "trace show" when specified trace not found, to make operator
awares this case.

Change-Id: Ie9dbeb3d89c41cdba8a7f695c3460218204d5dbf
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Adding a hits to notice operator when trace not found

A wrong HMAC key provided in original calling will make osprofiler
refuses to collect tracing data. This change updated hits output of
command "trace show" when specified trace not found, to make operator
awares this case.

Change-Id: Ie9dbeb3d89c41cdba8a7f695c3460218204d5dbf
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add port id and network id to IPAM related methods

This patch is a refactor to support patch [1]
Port id and network id are added to IPAM methods.
Those parameters are not used in the current patch but
will be used in [1] to be able to store IPAllocation
correctly.
This change was separeted from [1] to make [1]
easier to review.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100963

Change-Id: Ib3248e91baa99f34604605538da485a6a149ac2f

commit_message:
MySQL connections via HAProxy should not timeout

With the default 60 second timeout, many services will periodically
log "MySQL has gone away" as HAProxy has closed the connection.

Change-Id: Ied67344fbabcd77def4483be37a4706190ab28a0

commit_message:
Enhance V3 routers to store basic resource description

Part of JSON Home is providing a description of each resource
provided by the API. With this change, when resources are added
some basic description data required for JSON Home can be provided
and will be stored and made available.

bp json-home

Change-Id: I504cfd321f45e27f58b1998efc70e30a17805b74

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-21 12:40:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "libvirt: driver used memory tests cleanup

The libvirt's driver _get_memory_mb_used() currently reports proper
stats only if sys.platform is 'linux*', otherwise it reports 0.

In order for tests to work as expected on non-Linux platforms, mock
'sys.platform' to return 'linux2' to make sure the proper implementation
is called in _get_memory_mb_used().

While here, convert test_get_memory_used_normal() to use mock instead of
mox to make the test shorted and look similar to
test_get_memory_used_xen() that uses mock already.

commit_message:
libvirt: driver used memory tests cleanup

The libvirt's driver _get_memory_mb_used() currently reports proper
stats only if sys.platform is 'linux*', otherwise it reports 0.

In order for tests to work as expected on non-Linux platforms, mock
'sys.platform' to return 'linux2' to make sure the proper implementation
is called in _get_memory_mb_used().

While here, convert test_get_memory_used_normal() to use mock instead of
mox to make the test shorter and look similar to
test_get_memory_used_xen() that uses mock already.

Change-Id: If37fe2e447a52e73bcdbefc84b729931d2f7d0b8

commit_message:
Make setup endpoint idempotent

Making all setup endpoints idempotent. It's not 100% idempotent,
cause that would require unique indexes in the Keystone database.
But for our purposes, check for duplicates before storing endpoint
related data to Keystone will be enough.

Change-Id: I06ece3f9d1c38429b4bf0a934fce44bcac9c7f3c

commit_message:
Allow setup services endpoints

Adds setup_endpoints method which creates services endpoints including
service's user in keystone. It reflects behaviour of devtest
setup-endpoints script.

setup-endpoints command is included too. Endpoints configuration is
passed in JSON file or string.

Change-Id: I1095f5132147f5e855ca77d9164f555814c70391

commit_message:
Report claim and delete latency separately in the benchmark tool

The consumer worker actually performs two different operations. First
it claims a batch of messages, then it deletes each one before getting
the next batch.

Therefore, in order to better compare the latency of enqueuing a message
against other operations, this patch changes the reporting to provide
the individual latency of those other operations.

Change-Id: Iff7f6054904a03dc240d3f7a2a0529bd990f973b

commit_message:
Don't try to regenerate existing ssl certificates

Rerunning stack.sh after some failure unrelated to ssl setup will fail
due to certificates already existing in the CA index. Don't regenerate
them instead. This is a workaround making devstack development easier
rather than something typical user would run into.

Change-Id: Icfd4cb5132c8c9297eb73159e592b7006295184f

commit_message:
Adds xiv_ds8k cinder driver support

To use xiv_ds8k, set the following in localrc:
CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS+=,xiv:<volume-type-name>
XIV_DRIVER_VERSION=<version-string>
SAN_IP=<storage-ip-or-hostname>
SAN_LOGIN=<storage-admin-account>
SAN_PASSWORD=<storage-admin-password>
SAN_CLUSTERNAME=<cluster-name>
CONNECTION_TYPE=<connection-type> iscsi|fc
XIV_CHAP=<chap-type> disabled|enabled

Change-Id: I084ad2b2cb8e34c4a8aed77a52e90f9a9739f1f3

commit_message:
Add dev docs for transport/storage dirvers

This patch adds RSTs for both the transport and the storage layers. This
docs contain all the information found on the base drivers, which
describes the API of both layers.

commit_message:
Remove unused/mutable default args

Having mutable default args is a bad idea
(http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/#mutable-default-arguments).

The places where a new object would not be instantiated were left alone,
since it wouldn't make any difference (the same object would be
referenced anyway).

Change-Id: If71154d9bdb42f3ee284c4478c3ee7b177ec8009

Retry keystone on 500 errors

Sometimes keystone service is slow to start,
so retrying on 500 errors is necessary.

commit_message:
lockutils: catch BusyError when locking with timeout

If the IPC lock is used with a timeout value, an error can be raised. So
we need to catch it and convert it to a correct return value.

Change-Id: Iac91075eaf66a372a69f86822392d71de6ea947e

commit_message:
nova net-delete of associated network is not informative enough

Intially nova net-delete <Network ID> was raising an
"InternalServerError" in case the requested network to delete was associated to
any project.This error category â€œInternalServerErrorâ€ is appropriate but the
error message description is not informative enough.

Now, when the command is not able to delete the requested network because
it is associated with a project, a message stating â€œnetwork must be
disassociated from project <project-id> before deleteâ€ will be raised.
Updated the code to raise the new error message.

Closes-Bug: #1301373
Change-Id: I970fdab26f222fe97fcaf13f7f047fa95e98a16a

commit_message:
Add separate proc and worker options for producer and consumer

This patch splits the previous "worker" and "processes" config
options so that producers and consumers can be controlled
independently. In this way, a wider variety of loads can be
modeled.

Change-Id: Ia5c2cf941901c12108486de6cc9b9fa69477dc1a

subject: Fix collection order issues and unit test failures
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 11356, 'name': 'Louis Taylor', 'email': 'louis@kragniz.eu', 'username': 'kragniz'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-25 06:48:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix collection order issues and unit test failures

A randomized PYTHONHASHSEED caused the glance API to return certain data
in a nondeterministic order, breaking some tests. This patch sorts the
returned data before testing against a pre-sorted expected values.

This patch also fixes some unit test failures with the new version of
testtools (0.9.36) and directly calling setUp(). This was added to this
patch to avoid blocking more Glance tests.

Co-authored-by: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>
Co-authored-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

	glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py

	glance/tests/integration/legacy_functional/test_v1_api.py
	glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py
	glance/tests/unit/test_glance_replicator.py
	glance/tests/unit/test_vmware_store.py
	glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py
	glance/tests/unit/v2/test_tasks_resource.py

commit_message:
Fix collection order issues and unit test failures

A randomized PYTHONHASHSEED caused the glance API to return certain data
in a nondeterministic order, breaking some tests. This patch sorts the
returned data before testing against a pre-sorted expected values.

This patch also fixes some unit test failures with the new version of
testtools (0.9.36) and directly calling setUp(). This was added to this
patch to avoid blocking more Glance tests.

Co-authored-by: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>
Co-authored-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

Icehouse-Conflicts:
	glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py

Havana-Conflicts:
	glance/tests/integration/legacy_functional/test_v1_api.py
	glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py
	glance/tests/unit/test_glance_replicator.py
	glance/tests/unit/test_vmware_store.py
	glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py
	glance/tests/unit/v2/test_tasks_resource.py

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-06 06:02:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add notification for grant created and deleted events

Assigning and removing roles from users|groups and projects|domains
should be an auditable events. Thus, we should start sending out
notifications when these events occur.

One of the limitations of the way we were sending notifications
was that the decorator that was implemented sent only a single ID
as payload, in the case of role assignments, this was insufficient.

In this patch, I've modified the notification manager to expect
a payload rather than a single ID; added a create_grant method
at the assignment manager level (it was missing before); and lastly
added the decorator to the create and delete grant functions.

Change-Id: I62384dee4077cd29062e4b59adb4d5a38ad9234c

and delete grant functions.

commit_message:
Add CADF notifications for role assignment create and delete

Assigning and removing roles from users|groups and projects|domains
should be an auditable event. Thus, we should start sending out
notifications when these events occur.

implements bp role-assignment-notifications
Co-Authored-By: David Stanek <dstanek@dstanek.com>
Change-Id: I62384dee4077cd29062e4b59adb4d5a38ad9234c

commit_message:
Fix collection order issues and unit test failures

A randomized PYTHONHASHSEED caused the glance API to return certain data
in a nondeterministic order, breaking some tests. This patch sorts the
returned data before testing against a pre-sorted expected values.

This patch also fixes some unit test failures with the new version of
testtools (0.9.36) and directly calling setUp(). This was added to this
patch to avoid blocking more Glance tests.

Co-authored-by: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>
Co-authored-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

Conflicts:
	glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py

Partial-bug: #1348818
Change-Id: Ie92c6bb5663826713ca99e8f2f7d70f3faef6675

commit_message:
Add selenium tests to instance Retrieve Password action

This patch adds selenium tests to optional Retrieve Password action
on instance, that allows users to decrypt, on client side, the password
generated for the Admin session.

Change-Id: Id4fe598c1b046c9058ed848c0592361a0175b07a

commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but glance unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Redundant setenvs for specific test envs are removed to prevent them
from overriding the PYTHONHASHSEED value.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

This patchset also removes extra setUp() calls in v1 API tests. This is because
this patch has a catch-22 with the fix to the issues with the newer
version of testtools (0.9.36), since that patch fails without the fix to
tox.ini, and this patch fails with the newer version of testtools.

Co-Authored-By: Louis Taylor <kragniz@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Id0175b7a95c0ad07798b4603b5d1dd8e6d414561

commit_message:
Fix statistics page during deployment

The additional request on session creation was made and
403 error was raised in case of one of
the environment was deploying by other user.

commit_message:
Use list comprehension in create_bulk_networks

There is no need to pass size of list to create_bulk_networks in
network_client_base since it can be implemented with list comprehension.

Change-Id: I7eb8c7725d9569ad7c2fe853b72a51d10fe65bd1

commit_message:
Ensure ip6tables are used only if ipv6 is enabled in kernel

On systems where ipv6 module is not loaded in kernel we need to avoid
usage of ip6tables. This patch reads
/proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/default/disable_ipv6 file and if ipv6 is
disabled then ip6tables are not used in IptablesManager

Closes-Bug: #1352893

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3_agent.py

Change-Id: I07e5851aa25eb98b7a97dff86b9850475df85f64
(cherry picked from commit b6e9922364fca4d8d141fbb2f27024f7db79ca9e)

commit_message:
Correct return values of mocked methods in LBaaS API test

Mocked methods of neutronclient should return data structure
which neutronclient returns, but Horizon internal API object
(which inherits APIDictWrapper) is returned so far.

Change-Id: Ifbaeea3234bc232c8bbd2bb6ed2dd8f236358d1b

commit_message:
Fix migration set_length_of_description_field_metering

If PostgreSQL version is less than 9.1.13 migration
set_length_of_description_field_metering fails as there is no
special 'create if not exist' expression. This change add special
function for this case.

Closes-bug: #1348138

Change-Id: Ibe4f370fe400072abd281bd2313261790335eae2

commit_message:
Set InnoDB engine for all existing tables

Added the method in heal script that checks if mysql_engine
parameter is needed to be changed and if it is neseccary do this.
Also this change adds migation that set 'mysql_engine' to InnoDB
for all tables that were added into the database after healing.

Closes-bug: #1346966

Change-Id: Ia4d9038b99b2559d37272a17f5819a9dedd53f72

commit_message:
Upgrades, hardlink duplicated files

* fixed exec_cmd_iterator to retrieve
  stderr, otherwise it hangs
* added hardlinking of duplicate
  files in on_success action
  of openstack upgrade engine

Depends on: https://review.openstack.org/112080

Change-Id: I24e45d485138b16c6211e358482f238810c17a07
Closes-bug: #1352992

commit_message:
Use regular resources for nailgun packages

Virtual packages were defined for puppet
class nailgun::packages, but were never
realized. This is unneeded, so converting
these to normal resources.

Change-Id: Ie4ab791950c5ad69f619216750b4c3927d19f7c7
Closes-Bug: #1359818

commit_message:
Update nova driver's power_off() parameters

The nova driver's power_off() function received two new parameters
in commit c07ed15415c0ec3c5862f437f440632eff1e94df (nova).  The
in-tree drivers were all updated.  This updates the Ironic driver
and avoids a traceback during power off.

Change-Id: I0cbe7d954f0bcc16f7249304321a08d457eaba52
Closes-bug: #1359943

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-20 15:19:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support for UBoot.

UBoot needs the kernel and ramdisk to be post processed
using mkimage utility. This element helps user do it as
part of the DIB process.

Change-Id: I0e1039bf57d1ef11a3f9831d82e24b1ec2136c13
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-06-20 15:23:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support for UBoot.

UBoot needs the kernel and ramdisk to be post processed
using mkimage utility. This element helps user do it as
part of the DIB process.

This element needs u-boot-tools to be installed.

The load address and entry point for UBoot kernel can
be specified as shown in the example below.

Example:
    export UBOOT_KERNEL_ADDR=0x80000
    export UBOOT_KERNEL_EP=0x80000

Change-Id: I0e1039bf57d1ef11a3f9831d82e24b1ec2136c13
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2014-06-30 09:21:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support for UBoot.

UBoot needs the kernel and ramdisk to be post processed
using mkimage utility. This element helps user do it as
part of the DIB process.

This element needs u-boot-tools to be installed.

The load address and entry point for UBoot kernel can
be specified as shown in the example below.

commit_message:
Support for UBoot.

UBoot needs the kernel and ramdisk to be post processed
using mkimage utility. This element helps user do it as
part of the DIB process.

This element needs u-boot-tools to be installed.

The load address and entry point for UBoot kernel can
be specified as shown in the example below.

Example:
    export UBOOT_KERNEL_ADDR=0x80000
    export UBOOT_KERNEL_EP=0x80000

Change-Id: I0e1039bf57d1ef11a3f9831d82e24b1ec2136c13

commit_message:
Remove extra setUp() calls in v1 API tests

There are two test cases in the v1 API tests that explicitly call
setUp(). The new release of testtools correctly errors on this, so
stop doing it.

Change-Id: I6bfc00cc2f384e6e1ac091372cfff247038add42
